comment: AATF is involved in the regulation of apoptosis by inhibiting p53-driven apoptosis and modulating cellular outcome of the DDR signaling pathway. It is a p53 regulator that affects the transcription of TP53 and binds directly to p53. Upregulation of AATF expression in various cancers can suppress apoptosis and promote tumorigenesis.

BCR-ABL1 is a kinase that phosphorylates PDK1 in the PI3K/AKT pathway. The phosphorylation of PDK1 is essential for maintaining AKT activity and subsequently, sustaining BCR-ABL1 cell survival signals. Inducing BCR-ABL1 degradation may result in the degradation of PDK1 and AKT, thereby weakening LSC's cell survival signals and leading to apoptosis.
ACAA2 participates in cellular biological processes by regulating cell apoptosis. Overexpression of ACAA2 can induce cell apoptosis, while shRNA interference can inhibit this process.

Through single-cell RNA sequencing, it was found that there were changes in the expression levels of ACKR3 and other genes before and after PD-1 targeted therapy, including EGFR, AREG, WNT5A, PTPRK, GAS6, and ACKR3. Among them, ACKR3 and GAS6 showed differential expression levels after treatment in the tumors that responded to PD-1 treatment. These results suggest that ACKR3 may play a role in regulating apoptosis in PD-1 therapy

ACVR1 is related to Apoptosis in this paper and it is a crucial member of the bone morphogenetic protein (BMP) signaling pathway that induces apoptosis of patient-derived glioma-initiating cells (GICs)

ACVR1B participates in regulating immune cell apoptosis, thus helping to eliminate infected cells and reduce pathogen burden. An increase in ACVR1B mRNA levels has been observed through large-scale cohort studies targeting adult and pediatric sepsis.

Overexpression of ADORA1 decreases cleaved Caspase-3 and PARP expression, leading to reduced NPC cell apoptosis. Conversely, ADORA1 knockdown increases TRAIL-induced apoptosis sensitivity, resulting in upregulation of apoptotic markers.

AEN was found to be a direct target gene of p53 and an important downstream mediator of p53 in inducing apoptosis in this article. AEN is a typical exonuclease containing three conserved exonuclease domains, and its expression is regulated by the phosphorylation status of p53. AEN also possesses nuclear and nucleolar localization signals and translocates from the nucleolus to nucleoplasm upon execution of apoptosis. AEN amplifies DNA damage signals by digesting double-stranded DNA to form single-stranded DNA, leading to the enhancement of apoptosis.

The components of the renin _ angiotensin system (RAS) may be involved in cell growth and survival.Angiotensinogen (AGT) was shown to inhibit vascular cell growth and angiogenesisHuman glioblastoma cells can synthesize Renin and Angiotensinogen (AGT), and also secrete AGT.The addition of Renin inhibitors could induce apoptosis of glioblastoma cells, inhibit their DNA synthesis, and reduce viable tumor cell numbers.

The frequency of a TAATGC haplotype significantly increased in preeclampsia patients, which includes nucleotides g.1701, g.2041, g.2184, g.4673, g.4679 and g.4975. This haplotype may lead to overexpression of AGTR2, which inhibits the normal effects of AII and increases the possibility of apoptosis.

AIFM1 maintains the function of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I in healthy cells, while under cell death signaling stimuli, it is cleaved by calpains and then released from mitochondria into the cytosol and transported to the nucleus to cause cell death by chromatin condensation and large-scale DNA fragmentation.

AKT1 is involved in Apoptosis by inducing macrophage-mediated mitochondrial autophagy and increasing TGF-¦Â1 expression.AKT1 kinase activity induces macrophage mitochondrial reactive oxygen species (ROS) and mitophagy.

ANXA6 affects ubiquitination and degradation of EGFR, thereby inhibiting drug sensitivity.Exosomes derived from gemcitabine-resistant cells increase cell viability and inhibit apoptosis in sensitive TNBC cells, inducing gemcitabine resistance through ANXA6 upregulation.

APAF1 is a key component of the apoptosome, which activates the mitochondrial pathway of cell death. Deficiency in murine APAF1 leads to embryonic lethality with a phenotype affecting many aspects of developmental apoptosis, particularly prominent in the brain and inner ear. APAF1 is also mutated in human melanomas, and its depletion contributes to malignant transformation in a mouse model of cancer, revealing the importance of APAF1 in the onset and progression of cancer.

description: adaptor protein, phosphotyrosine interacting with PH domain and leucine zipper 1
comment: APPL1 deficiency can lead to cell death of the insulin-family cells.Additionally, the study found that APPL1 can reduce beta cell apoptosis induced by multiple-low-dose streptozotocin.APPL1 prevents these negative effects by dampening the NF¦ÊB_iNOS_NO axis,representing an important pathway regulating mechanism.

AR is related to apoptosis through post-translational modifications.In rodents,the AR and its C-terminal portion regulate apoptosis through the p53 pathway.Inhibition of AR leads to the cell cycle entering apoptosis.In humans,AR also regulates apoptosis in cell lines that overexpress AR.

ARHGEF2 activates TRKs,promoting cell proliferation,differentiation or inhibiting apoptosis.Overexpression of ARHGEF2 has been associated with the occurrence of some tumors,such as melanoma,hepatocellular carcinoma,and gastric cancer.When TRKs are inhibited,ARHGEF2 cannot activate the TRK signaling pathway,leading to apoptosis.

description: ADP ribosylation factor like GTPase 6 interacting protein 5
comment: ARL6IP5 is related to apoptosis by playing a role in activating embryonic apoptotic protease-8,9 and mediating intrinsic and extrinsic mitochondrial-dependent apoptotic pathways.In esophageal and breast carcinoma cells,ARL6IP5 inhibits apoptosis via the MAPK signaling pathway.Additionally,ARL6IP5 can mediate apoptosis by participating in intracellular calcium regulation or regulating protein synthesis on ER membranes.

Mitochondrial fission leads to apoptosis, whereas mitochondrial fusion is antiapoptotic. Accordingly, the study compared the growth of different cell lines after glucose starvation, and found that only cells expressing WT ARMC10 exhibited robust growth, while the cell death rate of ARMC10-KO cells was similar to that of AMPK¦Á1/¦Á2-DKO cells.

ARRB2 is an adapter protein of GPR54 and has an important regulatory role in the downstream signaling pathway of GPR54.The study found that Kisspeptin-54 treatment increased the expression of GPR54 and ARRB2,promoted protein-protein interaction between GPR54 and ARRB2,which further activated the downstream PI3K/AKT/GSK3¦Â signaling pathway in cells to alleviate oxidative stress and neuronal apoptosis.
Under the action of hormone disruptors, the expression of ASAH2 will decrease, leading to the accumulation of ceramide in skin cells, which can cause skin inflammation and cell apoptosis
Withaferin A induces intrinsic apoptosis and G2/M arrest via the ATF4-ATF3-CHOP pathway. Knockdown of ATF3 in U251 cells reduced WA-induced cell apoptosis and cell cycle arrest.

Withaferin A (WA) inhibits the growth of glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) by inducing intrinsic apoptosis and arresting the cell cycle at the G2/M stage through the ATF4-ATF3-CHOP axis-induced endoplasmic reticulum stress.WA exhibits significant growth inhibitory effects against GBM cells by inducing ATF4-ATF3-CHOP axis-triggered apoptosis and cell cycle arrest.

ATM,as a downstream target during apoptosis,can regulate the process by being degraded by proteases.When cells are induced to undergo programmed cell death,ATM is specifically cleaved,generating a kinase-inactive protein that affects DNA repair and damage signalling.The specific cleavage can depend on caspases.

ATP2A1 (SERCA2) is identified as one of the chief regulators of intracellular calcium concentration,and its misregulation has been linked to apoptosis.ATP2A1 plays an important role in controlling apoptosis and cell survival by regulating calcium concentration through the modulation of endoplasmic reticulum calcium pumps.

In MCF-7 and MDA-MB-231 breast cancer cell lines,resveratrol induces the expression of ATP2A3 gene,leading to an increase in the expression of SERCA3 gene,which changes the cytosolic calcium ion levels and the capacity for calcium release by the endoplasmic reticulum.These changes promote the occurrence of apoptosis in breast cancer cells.

In HeLa cancer cells, the binding of ATP5IF1 to the OSCP subunit of the mitochondrial ATP synthase can protect tumor cells from PTP-related apoptosis. This interaction is observed under normal conditions and may affect cell survival by regulating the interaction between PTP and ATP synthase subunits.
Endoplasmic reticulum stress induces apoptosis of AVP neurons through the PI3K/Akt and ERK signaling pathways,leading to the exacerbation of central diabetes insipidus.

description: BCL2 associated agonist of cell death
comment: BAD is related to apoptosis by undergoing dephosphorylation and translocating to the outer membrane of mitochondria after receiving apoptotic stimuli. This then disrupts the Bcl-xL/Bax complex, causing the release of Bax and the formation of transmembrane pores, leading to the loss of mitochondrial membrane potential and the release of apoptosis-related factors such as cytochrome C and AIF from the mitochondria, ultimately inducing cell apoptosis.

BAG3 is related to apoptosis by inhibiting it in the heart and some cancers by binding to Bcl2,and protein-protein interactions may play a role in the process.In cancer cells,inhibition of BAG3 reduces the level of anti-apoptotic protein Bcl-xL,promoting apoptosis.

BAG5 is related to apoptosis by exerting an anti-apoptotic function through suppressing PERK-eIF2-ATF4 activity while enhancing the IRE1-Xbp1 axis to reduce sensitivity to apoptosis,thus inhibiting ER-stress induced apoptosis.

BAG6 also plays a crucial role in DNA damage-induced and endoplasmic reticulum stress-induced apoptosis.BAG6 plays a critical role in DNA damage-induced cell death in conjunction with ATM/ATR by being phosphorylated.

BAK1 and BAX are key proapoptotic proteins in apoptosis induced by Neisseria gonorrhoeae (Ngo) infection and DNA damage.BAK1 is required for cytochrome c release from mitochondria,while BAX is required for activating effector caspases during Ngo infection.Moreover,BAK1 and BAX are activated sequentially,with BAK1 activation preceding BAX activation for Ngo-induced apoptosis.This reveals the differences between different stimuli-induced apoptotic pathways as well as the irreplaceable role of BAK1 and BAX in apoptosis.

BAK1 and BAX are key proapoptotic proteins in apoptosis induced by Neisseria gonorrhoeae (Ngo) infection and DNA damage.BAK1 is required for cytochrome c release from mitochondria,while BAX is required for activating effector caspases during Ngo infection.Moreover,BAK1 and BAX are activated sequentially,with BAK1 activation preceding BAX activation for Ngo-induced apoptosis.This reveals the differences between different stimuli-induced apoptotic pathways as well as the irreplaceable role of BAK1 and BAX in apoptosis.

BBC3 is one of the most common apoptosis inducers among the BCL2-homology 3 (BH3)-only subgroup of BCL2 family members.BBC3 directly activates the mitochondria by binding to all 5 known anti-apoptotic BCL2 family members,resulting in mitochondrial dysfunction and cell apoptosis.In methamphetamine abuse,the expression of BBC3 is closely related to cell apoptosis.

BCAP31 is one of the potential biomarkers for spermatogenesis and apoptosis.The expression of BCAP31 is different under two different feeding treatments.BCAP31 is an important anti-apoptotic antibody.

BCL10 regulates apoptosis signaling by interacting with TNF receptor associated factor-2 (TRAF2) and inhibitors of apoptosis proteins (cIAPs).The binding of BCL10 to TRAF2 and cIAPs is regulated by phosphorylation of BCL10,and phosphorylation of BCL10 results in binding of BCL10 to cIAPs and the dissociation of it from TRAF2,promoting apoptosis.

The BCL2 family is a highly conserved family that controls intrinsic apoptosis by regulating mitochondrial outer membrane integrity.In higher organisms,the BCL2 family regulates intrinsic apoptosis by controlling the integrity of the mitochondrial outer membrane,a function that is estimated to have originated in basal metazoans.

BCL2A1 is a member of the BCL-2 family of proteins that contributes to chemoresistance in certain types of tumors.It is believed to be a major factor of chemoresistance in B-cell chronic lymphocytic leukemia and melanoma.Many malignant tumors exhibit anti-apoptotic and drug-resistance effects by regulating BCL2A1 expression.

BCL2L1 regulates the permeability of the mitochondrial membrane and the release of cytochrome C,which then participates in apoptosis.In cancer,BCL2L1 is overexpressed and has been associated with invasive capacity,metastasis,stemness,and chemotherapy resistance.

The authors observed significant correlations between the lower expression of BCL2L10 and the hypermethylation of the BCL2L10 gene promoter in gastric carcinoma tissues. Through overexpression and silencing of the BCL2L10 gene, the authors found that BCL2L10 can induce apoptosis in gastric cancer cells via the mitochondrial pathway and may accelerate cell proliferation through the PI3K-Akt signaling pathway.

BCL2L11 is a protein of the BCL-2 family which can regulate the intrinsic apoptotic pathway within mitochondria and mediate cell apoptosis.Knocking out the BCL2L11 gene using siRNA can significantly reduce cell apoptosis and promote cell growth.

BCL2L12 is classified as a member of the BCL2 family and is a gene that mediates the process of apoptosis.The expression changes of BCL2L12 in response to chemotherapeutic drug.The expression level of BCL2L12 is associated with BCL2, Bcl-2 family,and ER-positive patients.

BCL2L14 is closely related to apoptosis as a pro-apoptotic gene regulated by p53.P53 interacts with BCL2L14, regulates the MAP4K4 gene and JNK pathway, which are involved in regulating cell signaling pathways.

BCL2L2 can play a role in controlling MK cell apoptosis.BCL2L2 can reduce MK apoptosis,increase the number of CD41a+ LLG MK cells,and increase the formation of proplatelets by 58%.This suggests that BCL2L2 can promote proplatelet formation and MK numbers,potentially becoming a novel target for improving MK and platelet yields in in vitro culture systems.

BCL3 promotes TNF-induced apoptosis in hepatocytes by regulating the deubiquitination of RIP1 and synergistically facilitating the formation of death-inducing Complex II.BCL3-depleted cells showed decreased sensitivity to TNF-induced apoptosis when stimulated with TNF/CHX.BCL3 deficiency protected both mice and in vitro hepatic cells from TNF-induced apoptosis.

BCLAF1 enhances NF-jB downstream of TNF activation by binding to its p50 subunit,thereby promoting the transcription of c-FLIP to inhibit the activation of caspase 8 and protecting cells from TNF-induced apoptosis.

BdkrB2 disruption and gestational salt stress induce fulminant metanephric apoptosis via a p53-Bax-dependent pathway.Inactivation of BdkrB2 makes mice more susceptible to renal dysplasia through p53 activation.Inactivation of BdkrB2 predisposes the salt-stressed embryo to p53-mediated metanephric apoptosis.germline deletion of p53 prevented Bax activation and normalized the apoptosis index.
BDNF can exert neuroprotective effects by inhibiting apoptosis.BDNF can protect cortical neurons from apoptosis and reduce protein damage caused by oxidative stress.

BECN1 nucleation can promote autophagy and thus reduce apoptosis,while the binding protein of BECN1, Bcl-XL,can inhibit autophagy and ZBTB28-induced degradation of Bcl-XL can promote autophagy and apoptosis.

BID is involved in apoptosis and controls the number of eosinophils.It affects the concentration of eosinophils in allergic airway reactions.Deficiency of BID increases apoptotic death of eosinophils, resulting in the resolution of pulmonary Th2-driven allergic reactions.

BIK induces a type of failed apoptosis leading to the survival of some cancer cells,which acquire aggressive phenotypes characterized by cancer stem-like cells,increased motility,and clonogenic survival.

BIRC6 is a protein that inhibits apoptosis by binding to apoptotic proteases and preventing them from being activated.BIRC6 also has E3 ubiquitin ligase activity and promotes the ubiquitination of target proteins to further protect cells from the effects of apoptosis.

description: biogenesis of lysosomal organelles complex 1 subunit 2
comment: BLOC1S2 can interact with the HIPPI protein and sensitize glioblastoma cells to apoptosis.The protein is widely expressed in normal tissue and malignant tumors,with lower expression levels in certain subtypes of tumors,and co-localizes with mitochondria.BLOC1S2 plays a role in death receptor-induced and mitochondrial apoptosis,facilitating caspase activation,cytochrome c release,and disruption of the mitochondrial membrane potential.

BMF is a member of the BCL-2 protein family and is involved in regulating cell apoptosis.BMF is a BH3-only protein that can bind and antagonize anti-apoptotic proteins.BMF can induce mitochondrial outer membrane permeabilization and activate BAX and BAK proteins,triggering programmed cell death.

In a model of fetal malformation in diabetes,BMP4 transgenic expression can prevent maternal diabetes-induced neuroepithelial cell apoptosis and alleviate neural tube defects.Diabetes can reduce BMP4 expression,leading to apoptosis and embryonic vasculopathy.BMP4 Tg Expression can inhibit diabetes-induced neuroepithelial cell apoptosis.

BMP5 promotes chondrocyte apoptosis, and its expression is significantly increased in knee articular cartilage tissues of osteoarthritis patients and DMM model mice. BMP5 inhibits cell apoptosis and senescence by activating p38 and ERK MAP kinases, thereby promoting the progression of osteoarthritis.

In young IVF patients, BMPR1B and FSH receptor density are both inversely proportional to the level of granulosa cell apoptosis during the course of follicular development.The reduction in apoptosis in older patients is associated with a compromised level of BMPR1B at the time of dominant follicle selection (10mm),while low levels of apoptosis in the largest follicles (23mm and above) are associated with the lack of down-regulation of BMPR1B,FSH receptor,and LH receptor combined.

BNIP3 promotes cell death in tumor and cardiac disease through the induction of apoptosis,which aggravates the progression of tumor and cardiac ischemia-reperfusion injury.The number of apoptotic cells in the renal cortex of bnip3_/_ CI-AKI mice and iohexol-treated BNIP3 knockdown HK-2 cells was significantly higher than that in the WT groups.Treatment with MCC950 or roxadustat mitigated iohexol-induced apoptosis and renal injury through the activation of BNIP3-mediated mitophagy.

As a member of the BCL2 family,BNIP3L interacts with the E1B 19 kDa protein to regulate cell death as an apoptosis protector.As a functional homolog of BNIP3,BNIP3L may have a role in tumor suppression.

BOK is shown to play a role in apoptosis and is located in various intracellular membranes such as the mitochondrial outer membrane,endoplasmic reticulum,and Golgi membrane.The study found that BOK's transmembrane domain (TMD) forms stable oligomers and hetero-oligomerizes with MCL-1's TMD. MCL-1 can then tether BOK to the mitochondrial membrane through TMD interactions,thereby regulating the cell death pathway induced by BOK.
BRCA1 regulates sensitivity to microtubule poisons when generating stress response.Studies have shown that cells with low BRCA1 expression are more resistant to vinorelbine-induced apoptosis.
The C-terminal oligonucleotide/oligosaccharide-binding-fold domains of BRCA2 interact with p53 and that overexpression of BRCA2 may suppress p53-mediated apoptosis.

BRSK2 is involved in insulin resistance and intrinsic apoptotic pathways,and insulin can activate BRSK2's AMPK family members and molecular signaling pathways involved in cell apoptosis that interact with YWHAG.Under the condition of autoimmune thyroiditis (AIT),the dysfunction of the endoplasmic reticulum leads to endoplasmic reticulum stress and intrinsic apoptosis.When the expression of BRSK2 is downregulated,the expression of CHOP and caspase-3 is upregulated,thereby eventually enhancing endoplasmic reticulum stress-mediated intrinsic apoptosis.

BTK plays an important role in the development and survival of B cells.Through the Akt pathway,Btk upregulates the anti-apoptotic protein Bcl-xl,supports the anti-apoptotic of mature autoreactive B cells, and promotes their proliferation.However,when Btk is deleted, mature autoreactive B cells are unable to maintain their survival and are easily induced apoptosis due to the abnormal signal transduction of BCR without the support of Bcl-xl.
CAAP1 is a negative regulator of the intrinsic apoptosis pathway and can modulate caspase expression and activity,thus inhibiting apoptosis levels in gastric cancer cells.

Caspase-1 was found in the intestines of MLKL-deficient mice during the embryonic period of Casp8C362A/C362AMlkl_/_ mice.Meanwhile,the Caspase-1-dependent cleavage of GSDMD, Caspase-3,and Caspase-7 were detected in the tissues.The study showed that Caspase-1 and its adaptor ASC contribute to perinatal lethality.

CASP10 is a key enzyme in the apoptosis signaling pathway and acts as an activator of CASP8 in the process of apoptosis.Mutations in CASP10 have been shown to cause apoptosis impairment,resulting in immune disorders.

CASP12 is a signaling molecule associated with endoplasmic reticulum stress (ERS) pathway and can mediate ERS-induced apoptosis by activating CASP3.CASP12 inhibitor (Z-ATAD-fmk) pretreatment can partially suppress the apoptosis of stretched cells.

CASP12 is a signaling molecule associated with endoplasmic reticulum stress (ERS) pathway and can mediate ERS-induced apoptosis by activating CASP3.CASP12 inhibitor (Z-ATAD-fmk) pretreatment can partially suppress the apoptosis of stretched cells.

CASP2 is a cysteine protease that belongs to both the initiator caspase and executioner caspase groups, but its substrate specificity is more similar to executioner caspases.CASP2 may indirectly activate executioner caspases by inducing mitochondrial outer membrane permeabilization (MOMP),thus mediating programmed cell death.
CASP3 plays an important role in the execution of programmed cell death in response to specific intrinsic or extrinsic inducers, and is therefore closely related to apoptosis.

CASP5 is an executioner caspase that is involved in apoptosis.It was found to be associated with cholesterol-induced inflammatory demise of aortic valve fibroblasts and prostate cell apoptosis,both of which are caused by overexpression of Caspase 5.Caspase 5 has been found to play a role in regulating cell survival and death through calcium regulation of the cell membrane.

CASP8 is a protease with both pro-death and pro-survival functions.It mediates apoptosis induced by death receptors such as TNFR11,and suppresses necroptosis mediated by the kinase RIPK3 and the pseudokinase MLKL.Mice that lack caspase-8 display MLKL-dependent embryonic lethality. Casp8C362A/C362AMlkl_/_ mice die during the perinatal period.

High expression of CASP8AP2 increases the propensity of leukemic lymphoblasts to undergo apoptosis,while low expression of CASP8AP2 is associated with lower event-free survival and higher leukemia relapse rate.

CASP9 plays a crucial role in apoptosis during normal development of the central nervous system and early embryonic development. Apoptotic stimuli trigger the release of cytochrome c from mitochondria, which then binds to Apaf-1 leading to the activation of CASP9 and the cleavage of downstream caspases.

The deficiency of CAV1 leads to an increase in apoptosis rates of endothelial cells (ECs) and affects the activation of apoptosis-related signaling pathways, thereby affecting the radio-sensitivity of adjacent prostate cancer cells.

CCAR2 is a multifaceted protein regulating cell survival and death following cytotoxic stress.In terms of apoptosis regulation,CCAR2 contributes to cell survival by inhibiting p53 transcription factor through negative regulation of SIRT1,as well as to cell death by promoting the release of cytochrome c by modulating outer mitochondrial membrane permeabilization via binding Bim protein.
CCK can reduce cytokine-mediated apoptosis in beta-cell lines and in isolated mouse and human islets, providing a protective effect for beta-cells.

CD14 acts as a important receptor for macrophages to recognize and engulf apoptotic cells.CD14-dependent uptake of apoptotic cells is a non-inflammatory process,which is distinct from LPS clearance. In addition to apoptotic cell clearance,CD14 may also regulate cell apoptosis in monocytes and endothelial cells.CD14 plays a crucial role in non-inflammatory processes during apoptosis to ensure safe clearance of apoptotic cells.

CD24 mediates intracellular signaling in BL cells via the glycolipid-enriched membrane (GEM) domains or rafts,leading to the activation of Src family protein tyrosine kinases (PTKs) that induce apoptosis.

After recognition of particular antigens by the B cell receptor, cells initiate the mitochondrial-mediated apoptotic pathway, CD27 and CD40 signals can inhibit p53-independent apoptotic pathways induced by BCR ligation but only weakly regulate p53-mediated apoptotic pathways.
Some CAR-T cell therapy strategies that include CD28 have important implications for the safety of cells, such as in activating cell apoptosis in AP1903 and CD28-Cas9 treated cells.

CD38 is associated with apoptosis in B cells and can regulate apoptosis by inhibiting or inducing CD38 expression.CD38 on B cells can induce proliferation and apoptosis by crosslinking related cytokines, thus playing a role in apoptosis.In chronic B-cell lymphoblastic leukemia (B-CLL),CD38 is related to cell apoptosis,ZAP-70 protein tyrosine phosphorylation,and extracellular signal-regulated kinase (ERK) phosphorylation.CD38+ B cells are highly sensitive to apoptosis inducers.

description: CD3 epsilon subunit of T-cell receptor complex
comment: Different forms of cell apoptosis can lead to a decrease in CD3E expression.For example, Fas-L induces the loss of CD3-z and CD3-e expression through the Fas-FasL pathway, while other cell apoptosis signals such as the anticancer drug VP-16 can also cause a decrease in CD3E and CD3-z expression in T cells.

The MUC5AC-CD44 signaling pathway plays an important role in colorectal cancer cell apoptosis.MUC5AC interacts with CD44 via Src-mediated signaling to promote colorectal cancer cell migration,invasion,and survival.Inhibition of MUC5AC can down-regulate the expression of p53 and p21,and increase the expression levels of cleaved PARP, cleaved caspase-9,and tumor suppressor gene p53, thus promoting apoptosis of colorectal cancer cells.
CD5 signaling occurs through the B-cell antigen receptor (BCR) and translocation of the dimer to lipid rafts (LRs) on the cell membrane, leading to apoptosis.
The CD70-CD27 signal can transmit the help message by regulating the cytotoxic T lymphocytes's secondary expansion and avoiding TRAIL-mediated apoptosis.

CD74 affects the immediate early steps in Fas signaling and specific targeting of CD74 on the surface of cancer cells could sensitize them to Fas-mediated apoptosis,thereby increasing the effectiveness of chemotherapy regimens.

CDIP1 is involved in the apoptotic pathway,regulating the mitochondrial apoptotic pathway and inducing ER membrane-generated cell death by forming the Cdip1/BAP31 complex with Bcl-2.CDIP1 expression is closely related to TNF-¦Á signaling,and targeted siRNA silencing of CDIP1 can down-regulate activated Caspase-3,which can reduce endothelial cell apoptosis in ischemic and hypoxic conditions and promote cardiac angiogenesis and regeneration.
CDKN1A is involved in Apoptosis through its regulatory interaction with EHMT1.EHMT1 knockdown leads to upregulation of CDKN1A expression,inducing apoptosis and cell cycle arrest in lung cancer cells.

CDKN2D is involved in apoptosis through the molecular mechanism of mediated upregulation of CASP3 and BAX.Specifically,AFB1 induces upregulation of CDKN2D,leading to S-phase arrest.At the same time, AFB1 also induces upregulation of transcription levels of CASP3 and BAX,leading to mitochondrial pathway-mediated apoptosis.

CEBPB participates in the survival and anti-apoptotic process of skin cancer cells.Deleting the CEBPB gene leads to elevated levels of apoptosis and p53 protein activity,suggesting potential therapeutic applications for CEBPB in cancer treatment.

description: CASP8 and FADD like apoptosis regulator
comment: CFLAR is involved in apoptosis through the molecular mechanism of inhibiting CASP8 activation,leading to inhibition of apoptosis.

CHAC1 is a component of the unfolded protein response pathway and participates in regulating apoptosis.It is downstream of the ATF4-ATF3-CHOP signaling pathway and promotes apoptosis signaling through AIF and PARP.Overexpression of CHAC1 enhances apoptosis,while small interfering RNA targeting CHAC1 suppresses apoptosis.

Mutations in CHCHD10 can prevent apoptosis by preventing the change of mitochondrial structure.The expression of CHCHD10 with mutations can resist cell apoptosis induced by Paclitaxel or Paclitaxel analogue by reducing the release of cytochrome c in cells,indicating that the expression of mutant CHCHD10 has an inhibitory effect on cell apoptosis.
CHEK2 participates in oocyte apoptosis induced by ionizing radiation.It induces apoptosis of oocytes through the TAp63¦Á-hyper-phosphorylation pathway.

CIB1 participates in apoptosis by negatively regulating stress-activated MAPK signaling pathways through inhibiting activation of ASK1 and mitigating cell death induced by TNF-¦Á and 6-OHDA.CIB1 interacts with ASK1,interferes with the binding of TRAF2 to ASK1,and inhibits the autophosphorylation of ASK1,thereby blocking the activation of ASK1.

description: cell death inducing DFFA like effector b
comment: CIDEB is involved in the process of apoptosis,promoting the conversion of fatty acids to lipid esters and causing ¦Â-cell lipoapoptosis upon palmitate exposure.

CLU participates in the molecular mechanism of apoptosis through two forms,sCLU and nCLU,with different functions.sCLU is a cytoprotective factor,while nCLU is apoptosis-related protein.In colorectal cancer,the expression of sCLU is increased while nCLU is downregulated.These changes result in the escape of cell apoptosis and promote tumor progression.CLU affects the progression of colorectal cancer by regulating Ku70/80 DNA double-strand breaks repair and Bax-dependent apoptosis induction.

The decrease of COL2A1 was related to chondrocyte apoptosis.COL2A1 was described as one of the components of articular cartilage and protected the ECM from degradation by counteracting IL-1¦Â-induced chondrocyte injury through circ_0022383 overexpression.

description: CASP2 and RIPK1 domain containing adaptor with death domain
comment: CRADD participates in regulating apoptosis by serving as a connector between PIDD and caspase-2 in the process of forming the PIDDosome that promotes cell apoptosis.The binding of PIDD-DD to CRADD-DD activates the binding and activation of the CRADD CARD and caspase-2.The CRADD/caspase-2 signaling pathway is implicated in neurotrophic factor withdrawal and amyloid-beta-induced dendritic spine collapse and neuronal apoptosis,revealing its role in cortical sculpting and plasticity.

High concentration of hCG treatment can trigger ER stress and apoptosis of MLTC-1 cells.Silencing kCREB3 inhibits the ER stress pathway,resulting in the upregulation of p-IRE1 and p-EIF2S1 and the downregulation of GRP78 and CHOP,promoting cell survival and testosterone secretion of MLTC-1 cells. Meanwhile,CREB3 silencing can also inhibit the expression of Caspase-3 and BAX and enhance the expression of BCL-2.

description: cAMP responsive element binding protein 3 like 1
comment: CREB3L1 is an important DNA hypermethylated gene in human bronchial epithelial BEAS-2B cells,associated with downregulation of its mRNA levels,and induces mitochondrial-mediated apoptosis by downregulating the PI3K/Akt/CREB/Bcl-2 signaling pathway.
CRH is involved in apoptosis by promoting the ability of ovarian cancer cells to induce apoptosis of activated peripheral blood lymphocytes through increasing FasL expression.

CRIP1 is involved in Apoptosis by suppressing cell apoptosis through down-regulating the expression of proteins related to Fas-mediated apoptosis.CRIP1 can interact with Fas protein to stimulate its ubiquitination and degradation.

Myeloid cells in the injured nerve strongly express receptors for GM-CSF.GM-CSF is a cytokine that regulates the inflammatory milieu and is important for conditioning-lesion-elicited dorsal column axon regeneration.GM-CSF increases surface expression of galectin-3, and in non-neural tissues galectin-3 functions as a bridging molecule for efferocytosis of apoptotic immune cells.

CSNK2A1 is associated with apoptosis by participating in the regulation process of miR-1184 on colon cancer cell apoptosis.Researchers found that miR-1184 regulates the proliferation and apoptosis of colon cancer cells by targeting the CSNK2A1 gene.It was also demonstrated that overexpression of CSNK2A1 can reverse the effect of miR-1184 overexpression on colon cancer cell proliferation and apoptosis.

CSNK2A2 participates in spermatogenesis and sperm development by regulating germ cell programmed cell death.It has been found that male mice lacking the Csnk2a2 gene have increased numbers of apoptotic cells including spermatocytes and round spermatids in the testes.

Oxidized-low density lipoprotein can induce VSMC apoptosis, while H2S donor NaHS and CTH overexpression can reverse this phenomenon,while CTH knockout exacerbates this apoptosis.Western blot detection showed that the high expression of GRP78 under the action of ox-LDL indicates that CTH knockout caused endoplasmic reticulum stress, which also contributes to the occurrence of VSMC apoptosis.

CTNNA1 is associated with Apoptosis by interacting with the Trp53-mediated cell death pathway to reduce transitional gene expression and promote cell apoptosis.The researchers achieved specific modification of CTNNA1 in the surface epithelium of mouse embryos using RNAi technology.They found that in the absence of CTNNA1,cells undergo highly proliferation via the Ras-MAPK pathway due to the imbalance with the apoptosis pathway.
CTSC activates Granzyme B and induces perforin-dependent cell apoptosis reaction.

CTTN promotes resistance of ESCC cells to anoikis,thereby protecting cells from apoptosis and increasing the metastatic ability of ESCC cells.The protective role of CTTN in anoikis is correlated with the activation of the PI3K-Akt signaling pathway.

CUL1 participates in apoptosis as a subunit of the SKP1/CUL1/F-box(SCF) ubiquitin ligase complex.Viral protein Vpu competes with the binding of p53 protein and the ¦Á-TrcP subunit of the SCF complex,stabilizing p53 protein.Meanwhile, the interaction between stabilized p53 protein and Bax protein activates Bax protein to promote apoptosis.

CUL2 participates in apoptosis by regulating the stability of MAF1.CUL2 knockdown could increase the susceptibility of cells to undergo doxorubicin-induced apoptosis and the expression of cleaved caspase-3.In contrast,MAF1 knockdown led to a significant decrease in the fraction of apoptotic cells,protecting cells from doxorubicin-induced cell death, and attenuated cisplatin-induced cleavage of caspase-3.

CUL3 participates in apoptosis by catalyzing the ubiquitination and degradation of anti-apoptosis proteins, Bcl-2/Bcl-xL,through the Keap1-Cul3-Rbx1 complex,and increasing the expression of Bax, thereby inducing cellular apoptosis.

CUL4A plays an important role in anti-apoptosis and contributes to relative resistance of NSCLC cells to chemotherapy.Overexpression of CUL4A reduced the proportion of apoptotic cells, while suppressing CUL4A expression significantly increased the population of apoptotic cells.
CUL5 is a component of E3 ubiquitin ligase complexes and is involved in regulating apoptotic cell death and stabilizing p53.

CX3CL1 is a chemokine that is released through caspase and Bcl-2-regulated mechanisms after lymphocytes undergo Apoptosis,and it is quickly released from the surface of cells.CX3CL1 acts as a "find-me signal",binding with the CX3CR1 receptor and attracting macrophages to the site of Apoptosis.

CX3CR1 is involved in the formation of atherosclerosis by inducing apoptosis of VSMCs.When the IRS2-AKT-ERK pathway is impaired, the CX3CL1/CX3CR1 inflammatory pathway increases the apoptosis rate of VSMCs. Increased expression of CX3CR1 is associated with increased apoptosis of VSMCs and increased vulnerability of atherosclerotic plaques in mice models induced with insulin resistance and metabolic syndrome.

In non-adherent colorectal carcinoma cells,CXCL12 participates in apoptotic cell death by inducing an anoikis type of cell death.This type of cell death is induced by disruption of the interactions between cells and the extracellular matrix.

The inactivation of CYLD in periportal liver hepatocytes leads to spontaneous and chronic activation of TGF-b activated kinase 1 (TAK1) and c-Jun N-terminal kinase (JNK),resulting in the death of periportal liver cells.This triggers the activation of hepatic stellate cells and Kupffer cells,leading to progressive fibrosis,inflammation,production of tumor necrosis factor (TNF),and expansion of hepatocyte apoptosis toward the central veins.

description: cytochrome P450 family 1 subfamily B member 1
comment: CYP1B1 participates in Apoptosis by metabolizing melatonin to generate N-acetylserotonin (NAS), which induces mitochondria-dependent apoptosis in tumor cells.

By stable expression of DAB2IP in prostate cancer cells,DAB2IP can cause cell cycle arrest and is also a proapoptotic factor capable of potentiating intrinsic or extrinsic apoptotic pathways.Knockdown of endogenous DAB2IP diminished cell apoptosis in LY or TNF-treated cells compared with control siRNA.

DAP kinase participates in apoptosis by phosphorylating serine/threonine residues on proteins as a novel calcium/calcium-dependent enzyme.Restoration of DAP kinase expression can increase sensitivity to apoptotic stimuli and delay tumor growth in a foreign microenvironment.DAP kinase can suppress lung carcinoma metastasis and growth by inducing apoptosis.

DAP3 is a high-affinity GTP-binding adapter protein,which links TRAIL receptors DR4 and DR5 to apoptosis-inducing proteins and is necessary for TRAIL-induced apoptosis. Additionally,DAP3 associates with the pro-caspase-8-binding adapter protein Fas-associated death domain (FADD) and links FADD to TRAIL receptors DR4 and DR5.

There are multiple apoptosis-related mechanisms in which DAPK1 is involved.One mechanism involves DAPK1 binding with ERK to increase its phosphorylation ability of MLC (myosin light chain),ultimately leading to apoptosis.Furthermore,DAPK1 can recognize and phosphorylate CaMKII inhibitors,thereby altering the balance of collagen and calcium ions in cells,which can also lead to apoptosis.

DAPK2 can both promote and inhibit apoptosis. DAPK2 is involved in the phosphorylation of the BAD protein, which activates the process of self-consumption of cells,namely autophagy,which in turn facilitates apoptosis.DAPK2 can also inhibit apoptosis by inhibiting the phosphorylation of p53.

DAPK3 is widely studied in cancer treatment as it is considered an anti-cancer gene which induces cell death and inhibits cancer growth through overexpression.DAPK3 induces cell death in malignant tumors through the activation of its catalytic domain.

DAXX binds to Fas protein to activate the JNK pathway and induce apoptosis,and it can also induce apoptosis by activating ASK1.DAXX interacts with 4-hydroxynonenal (4-HNE) to inhibit DNA damage response pathway and promote apoptosis.Meanwhile,DAXX can be phosphorylated and translocated to the cytoplasm,promoting the heterodimerization of apoptotic receptors in DNA and generating apoptosis signal.

DBH is involved in apoptosis through the expression of Casp3 protein induced by rAAV-taCasp3 virus,resulting in the death of co-expressing neurons.DBH is a specific type of neuron called ventrolateral medulla (VLM) catecholaminergic neuron,which is associated with antigen adaptive immunity and tumor growth and participates in tumor development through the viral messenger.

DCC is involved in apoptosis through its dependence receptor mechanism,triggering the death of tumor cells.DCC does not induce apoptosis in the presence of its trophic ligand,netrin-1,but does induce apoptosis when netrin-1 is absent.

DDIAS can block the binding between FADD and DISC to prevent the activation of Caspase-8.DDIAS can also stabilize Caspase-8 by preventing its ubiquitination and proteasomal degradation to suppress extrinsic apoptosis mediated by death receptor.
DDIT3 participates in apoptosis through ER stress induced by Atg7 deficiency.Atg7 deficiency leads to the upregulation of DDIT3 and subsequently promotes ER stress-induced apoptosis.

DDIT4 is involved in the apoptosis induced by TDCIPP in PC12 cells. DDIT4 expression on mRNA and protein levels was enhanced in PC12 cells exposed to 5-60 ¦Ìmol/L TDCIPP.DDIT4 knockdown can effectively alleviate the autophagy induced by TDCIPP and inhibit cell apoptosis.

DDX3X is involved in apoptosis by affecting DNA damage repair and cell cycle regulation.Loss of DDX3X led to significant accumulation of DNA single-strand breaks and double-strand breaks in the liver,as indicated by sustained phosphorylation of histone H2AX.This resulted in profound ductular reactions, cell apoptosis, and compensatory proliferation in female mutants.
DDX47 is an RNA-binding protein involved in RNA processing and transport.DDX47 expression is correlated with rs34330,and knocking out the DDX47 gene significantly affects apoptosis.

DDX5 plays a role in both promoting and inhibiting apoptosis.Phosphorylation is a common post-translational modification that mediates DDX5's promotion of cancer cell proliferation and is associated with resistance to anticancer drugs.DDX5 has a synergistic effect when combined with anticancer agents such as piceatannol and TNF-¦Á,suppressing the anti-apoptotic function.

DEDD participates in apoptosis signaling through its death effector domain (DED).When localized in the nucleus,DEDD can inhibit RNA polymerase I-dependent transcription while activating caspase-6 to induce apoptosis through the nuclear pathway.

DEDD2 participates in apoptosis by binding to caspase-8 and caspase-10.DEDD2 can also bind to itself and DEDD to form dimers and oligomers,thereby promoting the activation of caspase-8/10.It has been observed that DEDD2 is highly expressed in many cancer cells and may be associated with abnormalities in the 19q13.2 chromosomal region.Both the N-terminal DED domain and the C-terminal region of DEDD2 can induce apoptosis.

OMA1-deficient cells displayed clear signs of apoptosis when DNA damage occurs,including the upregulation of the apoptosis-inducing factor p53 and its target genes.DELE1 was found to be part of a pathway that transmits information from mitochondria to the cytoplasm,thereby activating the mitochondrial stress response and regulating apoptosis.

description: DEP domain containing MTOR interacting protein
comment: DEPTOR promotes the apoptotic process through its suppression of the PI3K/Akt activity,limiting tumour initiation and the circulatory inflammation response.It is highly expressed in some cancer types such as MM and T-ALL and is associated with poor prognosis and reduced survival for patients.

DIABLO participates in apoptosis by relieving the inhibition of caspase-9 through formation of a complex with XIAP.After binding to XIAP,DIABLO can competitively occupy the same binding site on caspase-9 as XIAP,blocking the inhibition of caspase-9 by XIAP.

DIDO1 participates in apoptosis by triggering cell death when overexpressed in cell lines,which can be prevented by blocking caspase activity or Bcl-2 overexpression.The massive cell death induced by DIDO1 overexpression can be blocked through overexpression of hBcl-2,indicating that DIDO1 is upstream of the caspase cascade.

description: DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member A1
comment: DNAJA1 and DNAJA2 are strongly expressed in spermatocytes,and prevent mitochondrial apoptosis by inhibiting the translocation of Bax to mitochondria.In mice lacking DNAJA1,a large number of apoptotic spermatocytes were observed,with actual impacts including reduced sperm count and motility.

description: DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member C10
comment: DNAJC10 is involved in promoting apoptosis in LUAD cells by regulating the activity of CENPU.The overexpression of DNAJC10 can rescue the promoting effect of CENPU knockdown on cell apoptosis,indicating that DNAJC10 participates in the activity of CENPU in LUAD cells.

DNM1L is involved in apoptosis is by regulating cell death through its effects on mitochondrial dynamics.When DNM1L is defective,mitochondrial dynamics are affected,leading to a decrease in mitochondrial fusion or fission.This causes an imbalance in mitochondrial dynamics,which accelerates cell death.The injection of anti-DNM1L antibody reduces the expression of mitochondrial apoptosis-related proteins such as Bad while increasing the expression of anti-apoptotic proteins such as XIAP.

DPF2 is involved in apoptosis as a regulatory factor.It has been identified as an apoptosis-inducing protein in mouse myeloid cells.DPF2 belongs to the d4-protein family,which includes proteins with regulatory functions.

description: dual specificity tyrosine phosphorylation regulated kinase 2
comment: DYRK2 is suggested to be a regulator of apoptotic response.Previous studies have shown that DYRK2 can be stabilized after DNA damage through ATM-dependent Thr33 and Ser369 phosphorylation and induce cell apoptosis by phosphorylating p53 at Ser46.Some studies also suggest that DYRK2 has anti-apoptotic function.

E2F1 mediates apoptosis by transcriptionally inducing multiple pro-apoptotic genes and downstream effects.The study identifies FOXO transcription factors as E2F1 target genes that form a regulatory loop, which reinforces gene induction for multiple apoptotic genes.In cancer,the E2F1/FOXO axis is frequently blocked,and some therapeutic approaches enhance E2F1-induced apoptosis in a FOX03-dependent manner by targeting inactive survival kinases.

E2F2 can independently induce cell death in cone photoreceptors,without the involvement of E2F1 and E2F3.In addition,cell death induced by E2F1 is independent of p53 and p73,whereas cone cell death induced by E2F2 is dependent on p53.
EDA2R participates in apoptosis by mediating podocyte injury in a high glucose environment and promoting cell apoptosis by increasing ROS production.

description: eukaryotic translation initiation factor 2 alpha kinase 3
comment: EIF2AK3 is involved in apoptosis by regulating the ERS-apoptosis and autophagy programs.When FFSS induces ERS-apoptosis,EIF2AK3 as a downstream target of MTORC1 promotes the expression of CASP12 and DDIT3,and inhibits autophagosome-lysosome formation.

description: elongation factor for RNA polymerase II 3
comment: Ectopic expression of ELL3 can induce cell apoptosis. P53 is a direct transcriptional activator of the ELL3 gene, and p53 directly regulates the expression of ELL3 during stem cell apoptosis.

ENO1 participates in apoptosis by regulating PASMC apoptosis.RNA silencing ENO1 and using ENO1 inhibitor ENOblock can suppress PASMC proliferation and induce its apoptosis.Specifically, reducing ENO1 levels can increase the cleavage of PARP,caspase 3,and caspase 9,and promote the apoptotic rate through TUNEL experiment.Overexpression of ENO1 can increase PASMC's resistance to apoptotic stimuli and reduce its apoptotic rate.

Inhibiting the p300 enzyme in Treg cells can promote anti-tumor immune responses and alter the phenotype of Treg cells to promote apoptosis in steady state.Deletion of Ep300 or using the C646 drug to inhibit p300 can reduce proliferation and accumulation of Treg cells in tumors and enhance the function of T cells within tumors.

The frequency of apoptosis in non-small cell lung cancer cells (NSCLC) can be increased by transfecting cells with EPHA2-specific small interfering RNA (siRNA).DOX-induced shRNA silencing of EPHA2 resulted in increased frequency of apoptosis and mitigated tumor growth.

EPO can increase the number of red blood cells by preventing the apoptosis of erythroid progenitor cells.But it has also been found to have tissue-protective effects and may participate in the regulation of apoptosis.

ERBB3 prevents apoptosis by forming ERBB3-ERBB4 heterodimers to activate the PI3K/AKT/FRAP1/RPS6 pathway,which regulates cell cycle arrest and apoptosis. Loss of ERBB3 results in elevated apoptosis in mouse and human colon cancer cells,especially in the presence of EGFR blockade.A secondary pathway, which is EGFR independent but ERBB3 dependent,might also contribute to cancer cell survival mediated by an ERBB3-ERBB4 heterodimeric complex.

description: ERCC excision repair 6, chromatin remodeling factor
comment: Overexpression of ERCC6 through transfection of pcDNA3.1 (+)-ERCC6 into HCC cells can block the apoptosis of tumor cells induced by rAd-p53 and/or Ad-NDRG2.Reducing the expression of ERCC6 can increase the sensitivity of tumor cells to apoptosis induced by chemotherapy.Overexpression of NDRG2 can downregulate the expression of ERCC6 in tumor cells,thus enhancing p53-mediated apoptosis of liver cancer cells by attenuating nucleotide excision repair capacity.

ERN1 is activated through UPR and participates in mediating the mitochondrial and death receptor pathways of E2-induced apoptosis in antihormone-resistant breast cancer cells.The downstream effector of ERN1 phosphorylation,eIF2a,is activated within 24 hours of E2 treatment.

ERO1A participates in apoptosis by generating ROS. Overexpression of microglial ERO1A exacerbates cell apoptosis and behavioral outcomes,while suppression of microglial ERO1A significantly reduces cell apoptosis.

ERP29 promotes the progression of colorectal cancer by inhibiting apoptosis. The authors found that there were more apoptotic cells in tumor tissues formed from DLD-1shERp29 cells than that from control DLD-1shNC cells using TUNEL test,indicating ERp29 may inhibit apoptosis of DLD-1 cells.ERP29 could decrease the sensitivity to 5-FU in DLD-1 cells and lower the cell apoptosis rate in the process of 5-FU-induced apoptosis using CCK-8 assay and flow cytometry.

EYA1 is involved in the inhibition of apoptosis and may be associated with the activity of ATM/ATR and the hypoxia state of the tumor.EYA1 is shown to inhibit apoptosis,but this suppression does not depend on its phosphatase activity.EYA1 may rely on the activity of ATM/ATR and the relative hypoxia state of the tumor to regulate apoptosis.
EYA2 participates in apoptosis because it plays a crucial role in the cell cycle progression and survival of GSCs,and inhibition of EYA2 Tyr phosphatase activity results in apoptosis.

EYA3 is involved in the apoptosis of cells related to pulmonary arterial hypertension,because it promotes pulmonary vascular remodeling by promoting the survival and proliferation of pulmonary arterial vascular cells in a DNA-damaging,hostile microenvironment,which leads to pulmonary hypertension.Inhibition of the EYA3 tyrosine phosphatase activity with Benzarone can attenuate the development of experimental pulmonary hypertension,and increased apoptosis is seen in lung tissue upon treatment with Benzarone.

The expression level of EYA4 is associated with apoptosis response. The experiment showed that in karyotypically normal EYA4kd cells,the numbers of early (AV +/PI -) and late (AV +/PI +) apoptotic cells were significantly reduced compared to the control group.This indicates that EYA4 plays a promoting role in cell apoptosis.Other some literature suggests that EYA4 may act as a transcriptional co-activator to mediate its TSG function,and EYA4 may cascade with GADD45a to regulate cell apoptosis.

FADD is a crucial component of extrinsic apoptosis and necroptosis,and is related to cell death pathways.MKRN1 E3 ligase regulates FADD levels through ubiquitination and proteasomal degradation.Depletion of MKRN1 leads to FADD stabilization, resulting in hypersensitivity to extrinsic apoptosis and necroptosis facilitated by caspase-8 and caspase-3 cleavage.

FAF1 is a pro-apoptotic factor that also regulates several signaling pathways in which XIAP is involved.The DEDID domain of FAF1 specifically interacts with XIAP in the regulation of apoptotic cell death.Conversely, XIAP can interfere with the caspase cascade and block FAF1-mediated cell death.Cell experiments have also shown that FAF1 transfection and anti-FAS stimulation induce cell apoptosis,while overexpression of XIAP can prevent FAF1-induced apoptosis.
FAIM plays an anti-apoptotic role, mainly in BCR-activated B cells,by resisting Fas-mediated cell death and affecting TCR-mediated apoptosis in B cells and thymocytes.

FAIM2 was found to be an anti-apoptotic protein,which can protect myoblasts from DUX4-induced cell death by down-regulating the expression of miR-3202.Overexpression of FAIM2 can protect cells from oxidative stress and BCL-2 inhibitor-induced apoptosis.

description: family with sequence similarity 162 member A
comment: FAM162A is an important molecule associated with neuronal cell apoptosis.The experimental results showed that FAM162A was involved in the process of OGD-induced apoptosis of HT22 cells together with Bax.DCP2 can promote apoptosis of OGD-treated HT22 cells by regulating the expression of BAX and FAM162A, while RNCR3 can protect OGD-treated HT22 cells by decreasing the expression of BAX and FAM162A.

Fas is a part of Fas Ligand (FasL)-induced cell death process and is associated with apoptosis.Fas is the receptor for FasL and is expressed abundantly in various tissues,particularly thymocytes,activated T cells,or T cells transformed by HTLV-1 or HIV.Fas and TNFR1 must be oligomerized to be activated.The activated caspases cleave various cellular components,a process that leads to morphological changes of the cells and nuclei,as well as to degradation of the chromosomal DNA.

FASLG participates in apoptosis mainly through its binding with its receptor FAS to activate the death program,leading to morphological and nuclear changes in target cells,as well as degradation of chromosomal DNA.

The experiment found that reducing the expression of FASTK can significantly increase apoptosis and thus inhibit tumor growth.FASTK is involved in the induction of the Fas receptor apoptosis pathway,regulates mitochondrial metabolism,and controls post-transcriptional modifications of RNA responses with TIA1.

FBH1 promotes DNA double-strand breakage and apoptosis in response to DNA replication stress through its interaction with RPA.The study determined that the helicase domain of FBH1 is required for the efficient phosphorylation of RPA2 on Ser4 and Ser8 in response to replication stress.The persistence of Ser33 phosphorylation and accompanying decrease in Ser4 and Ser8 phosphorylation suggests fewer DSBs are generated in cells depleted of FBH1 compared with control cells.

description: F-box and WD repeat domain containing 7
comment: FBXW7 is involved in the pathway of apoptosis and EMT,and its low expression in gastric cancer tissues is related to the promotion of apoptosis and proliferation inhibition of gastric cancer cells.Further research has shown that FBXW7 down-regulates RHOA through the Proteasome pathway to inhibit EMT.

FEM1B is a protein that mediates apoptosis of colon cancer cells.By regulating the expression of proapoptotic proteins,it induces apoptosis of colon cancer cells.It is expressed in primary human colon cancer specimens and malignant colon cancer cells and its expression can be upregulated by proteasome inhibitors,leading to apoptosis.

FGA induces dephosphorylation of tobacco phosphatidylinositide 3-kinases (AKT),blocking activation of mTOR downstream of AKT,and causing apoptosis in lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) cells.Specifically, FGA induces apoptosis in LUAD cells by downregulating the expression of BCL2 and MCL1,but not affecting BCLXL expression.
The study showed that knockdown of FGB obviously promoted apoptosis of breast cancer (BC) cells.
FGF10 can inhibit cellular apoptosis during hepatic ischemia-reperfusion,reduce the number of apoptotic cells,decrease levels of c-CAS-3,and lower the Bax/Bcl-2 ratio to alleviate liver injury.

FGFR1 participates in apoptosis through the combined inhibition of FGFR1 and PLK1 in KRAS-mutant cancer cells.The study showed that the combined treatment of FGFR1 and PLK1 inhibitors can promote apoptosis in cell models by upregulating reactive oxygen species (ROS),leading to oxidative stress-activated c-Jun N-terminal kinase (JNK)/p38 pathway and E2F1-induced apoptosis.
The R248C FGFR3 mutation reduces apoptosis in HaCaT keratinocytes. This mutation leads to increased cell growth at confluence, further promoting tumor development.

FHIT mediates apoptosis in lung and cervical cancer cells.The reintroduction of FHIT induces apoptosis in all FHIT-negative cell lines,particularly in Calu-1,H460,A549 among the lung cancer cell lines and SiHa cells among cervical carcinomas.The mechanism by which FHIT induces apoptosis is through the activation of caspase-8, leading to the activation of caspase-3 and subsequent induction of apoptosis.

FIGNL1 overexpression can promote non-small cell lung cancer cell proliferation,decrease apoptosis,and increase cell fission and migration abilities.Knockdown of FIGNL1 can reduce lung cancer cell proliferation,increase the ratio of apoptosis,and decrease their migration and invasion abilities.

FIS1 participates in apoptosis by regulating Bax/Bak-driven cell death through its interaction with ER membrane protein Bap31.The dynamic structural and functional liaison between mitochondria and the endoplasmic reticulum (ER) is facilitated by the interaction between FIS1 and Bap31,promoting a two-way communication in cell death from mitochondria to ER and back again,making the process of cell death more complex and intricate.

FNIP2 is related to apoptosis and plays a role in inducing cell death as a protein component of MAPO1 in the signal transduction pathway.The study found that the AMPK-MAPO1-FLCN complex plays an important role in O6-Methylguanine-induced apoptosis,so MAPO1 may regulate the activation of AMPK by binding to FLCN to control the induction of apoptosis triggered by O6-methylguanine.

FXN's involvement in apoptosis is achieved through the apoptotic death of neuro cells,which is a spontaneous process of cell death typically caused by DNA damage or other severe cellular stress.When the level of FXN gene expression declines,FXN-defective cells undergo uncontrolled apoptosis.The apoptotic death of FXN-deficient cells is achieved by the activation of the neuronal apoptotic pathway.

description: FYN proto-oncogene, Src family tyrosine kinase
comment: FYN can interact with the C-terminus of the NOX4 protein,regulating the ROS production and apoptosis induced by NOX4 in cardiomyocytes.Overexpression of FYN can negatively regulate the activity of NOX4,inhibiting NOX4-induced apoptosis in cardiomyocytes,while downregulation of FYN can aggravate cell apoptosis.

FZD9 is related to apoptosis in this paper, and knockdown of c-Fos gene can inhibit the proliferation,migration and invasion of MG63 cells,promote apoptosis,and the expression of Fzd9 is also regulated by c-Fos gene.

G0S2 promotes apoptosis by interacting with and inhibiting Bcl-2 from forming anti-apoptotic Bcl-2/Bax heterodimers.Additionally, ectopic expression of G0S2 induces apoptosis in transformed cells and sensitizes primary cells to undergo apoptosis in response to DNA damage.G0S2 is induced by TNF¦Á through the NF-¦ÊB pathway.

GABARAP can directly bind to the protein Nix,which regulates apoptosis,thus becoming one of the links between apoptosis and autophagy.In addition,the expression level of GABARAP can be induced under various stress conditions such as nutrient deprivation and oxidative stress,thus initiating the autophagy pathway.

GATA1 is related to erythrocyte apoptosis, participates in the regulation of the HSP70/GATA1 axis and is involved in the molecular mechanism of apoptosis.The level of GATA1 protein is decreased in DBA patients,which causes delayed erythroid differentiation and increased erythrocyte apoptosis.Therefore,by regulating the HSP70/GATA1 axis,especially the expression of HSP70,erythrocyte apoptosis can be reduced,and their survival can be increased.

GATA4 is related to the anti-apoptotic pathway,participates in regulating the transcription of genes such as Bcl-2,and is involved in the molecular mechanism of apoptosis.SIRT6 can promote GATA4 chromatin binding,thereby enhancing its ability to regulate anti-apoptotic gene transcription.By regulating the SIRT6-TIP60-GATA4 axis,the anti-apoptotic pathway can be promoted,thereby reducing the cardiotoxicity of doxorubicin in clinical use.

GCLM is associated with the process of PTL-induced apoptosis in BCPAP cells and its expression is up-regulated.PRM analysis showed that the protein expression of GCLM increased in these cells,while its mRNA expression level did not change.It can be inferred that GCLM is involved in the process of PTL-induced apoptosis in BCPAP cells,and its role may be achieved by regulating the intracellular redox state.

Rotenone reduces the expression of GDNF and suppresses the downstream PI3K/AKT/GSK-3¦Â signaling pathway. Dapagliflozin can prevent cell apoptosis in PD rats by upregulating the expression of GDNF and activating the PI3K/AKT/GSK-3¦Â pathway.
GDF-15 can mediate either pro- or anti-apoptotic functions depending on the cellular context.GDF-15 exerts its anti-apoptotic effect by binding to GFRAL.

The downregulation of GGCT inhibits the growth of MCF-7/ADR breast cancer by inducing cell apoptosis and necrosis.This might be achieved by disrupting the balance of intracellular glutathione (GSH) and thus affecting the function of Nrf2.

GHITM is classified as part of the BI1 (transmembrane Bax inhibitor 1) family,which is believed to play a role in regulating apoptosis.GHITM reduces cell death in antibody-induced apoptosis,indicating a protective role in apoptosis.

GNAI2 is related to apoptosis and as a downstream target of SNHG1, participates in inhibiting the inflammatory response and apoptosis of HUVECs induced by ox-LDL.GNAI2 participates in apoptosis by being up-regulated by SNHG1 to inhibit the inflammatory response and apoptosis of HUVECs induced by ox-LDL.

The interference of GNAI3 shRNA significantly reduced cell apoptosis.In addition,under the action of the reverse structure of Mir24-2-5p,the downregulation of GNAI3 mRNA expression also led to a significant decrease in apoptosis.

In pancreatic islet cells, both G-1 and estrogen,which can bind to GPER1,can protect pancreatic ¦Â cells from cytokine-induced and H2O2-induced apoptosis.At the same time,compared with GPER1 knockout mice,wild-type mice's myocardial cell apoptosis after ischemia/reperfusion injury was significantly reduced.

The expression of GPX1 is reduced in myocardial cells after I/R injury,while SalB treatment regulates the TRIM8/GPX1 pathway,promotes the expression of GPX1 protein,reduces ROS generation,and the level of cardiac cell apoptosis.At the same time,GPX1 overexpression can alleviate I/R-induced cardiac cell apoptosis.

description: glutamate ionotropic receptor NMDA type subunit associated protein 1
comment: GRINA participates in apoptosis by modulating the balance of calcium ions in the endoplasmic reticulum. The study found that TMBIM3/GRINA has strong synergistic activity with TMBIM6/BI-1 in regulating ER calcium homeostasis and apoptosis.Loss-of-function studies in Drosophila and zebrafish embryos revealed an essential role of TMBIM3/GRINA and TMBIM6/BI-1 in preventing cell death during ER stress.

GSDME is cleaved by caspase-3,which liberates the GSDME-N domain that forms pores in the plasma membrane to induce pyroptosis,while GSDME-N can permeabilize the mitochondrial membrane and release cytochrome c to activate the apoptotic pathway.GSDME deficiency affects caspase-3 activation under both intrinsic and extrinsic apoptotic stimuli.

GSK3A participates in apoptosis of multiple myeloma cells.GSK3A/B is one of the targets of SMERs to amplify and execute apoptotic signaling downstream of the PI3K/AKT/mTOR pathway,particularly within the cytoprotective microenvironment of MSCs that mimic the bone marrow niche.

GSK3B promotes apoptosis by activating Bax,leading to tubular injury and acute ischemic kidney injury.In vitro and in vivo experiments showed that exposure of renal epithelial cells to metabolic stress activated GSK3B,Bax and caspase 3,inducing apoptosis.Expression of a constitutively active GSK3B mutant activated Bax and decreased cell viability.Conversely,inhibition of GSK3B promoted cell viability.Knocking down GSK3B by RNA interference abrogated cell death induced by constitutively active GSK3B.
GSKIP has a protective effect against apoptosis of cardiomyocytes in hypoxia/reoxygenation (H/R) injury.Overexpression of GSKIP attenuated apoptosis and ROS production induced by H/R injury.

GSTP1 participates in regulating the cell cycle and apoptosis,and the mutation status of different sites of GSTP1 also affects the apoptotic function of cells.Different haplotypes of GSTP1 have different effects on cell proliferation and apoptosis.

GZMB induces apoptosis in target cells through the cleavage and activation of caspase family members and DFF45/ICAD,a nuclease responsible for DNA fragmentation.The study establishes a cellular death assay and shows that GZMB-mediated apoptosis can occur independently of caspase-3 activity,highlighting its physiological importance for CTL-induced target cell death.

AT2R stimulation leads to HDAC1 dephosphorylation at amino acids 421/423,which inhibits the deacetylation of Lys379-p53 and results in p53 activation and subsequent apoptosis and cell anti-proliferation.

description: homocysteine inducible ER protein with ubiquitin like domain 1
comment: Overexpression of HERPUD1 induced cell death (apoptotic nuclei) in both LNCaP and Hep3B cells,and HERPUD1 was present in the entire cytoplasm instead of localized at the ER when apoptotic nuclei were observed in the cells.HERPUD1 expression induced apoptosis via activation of caspase-3 and DNA degradation as detected by the TUNEL assay.

HGF participates in apoptosis by activating the c-MET pathway,leading to cell cycle arrest,DNA damage, and apoptosis.KSHV can activate the HGF/c-MET pathway in vitro and in vivo,which is closely related to the pathogenesis of PEL.

HIC1 is shown to be involved in apoptosis,regulating p53- dependent apoptotic DNA damage response in mammalian cells.When HIC1 function is lost,cells cannot undergo apoptosis and survive DNA damage.HIC1 interacts with SIRT1,repressing SIRT1 transcription through HIC1's POZ domain.In the HIC1- SIRT1-P53 feedback loop,HIC1 promotes P53-mediated apoptotic DNA damage response.

In the study of inhibiting NLRP3 inflammasome,upregulating hypoxia-inducible factor 1 alpha subunit (HIF1A) and BNIP3-mediated mitophagy helped mitigate renal injury and apoptosis in the CI-AKI mouse model.Through the treatment of MCC950 and Roxadustat,the study further confirmed that NLRP3 inhibitors can mitigate apoptosis of renal cells and regulate BNIP3-mediated mitophagy by stabilizing HIF1A.

HINT1 induces apoptosis in SW480 and MCF-7 cells independent of its enzymatic activity.Specifically, HINT1 upregulates the expression of p53 and Bax,and downregulates the expression of apoptosis inhibitor Bcl-2,but has no effect on Bad and Puma levels.HINT1 is associated with the Bax promoter and is a component of the Tip60 histone acetyltransferase complex,suggesting it is involved in the regulation of Bax expression.Knockdown of HINT1 results in downregulation of p53 and Bax.A mutant HINT1 (H112N) protein defective in enzymatic activity as an AMP-NH2 hydrolase is not impaired in the induction of apoptosis,suggesting that HINT1's pro-apoptotic activity is independent of its enzymatic activity.

HIP1 is involved in HIPPI-mediated transcription of the caspase-1 gene and apoptosis.The article states that HIP1 is a molecular partner of HIPPI,which can recruit procaspase-8 and activate the initiator caspase and its downstream apoptotic cascades.The article indicates that HIP1 plays an important role in HIPPI-mediated transcription of the caspase-1 gene and apoptosis

HIP1R-deficient mice showed reduced numbers of gastric epithelial cells and increased apoptotic cells,including parietal cells.Through TUNEL staining and activated caspase-3 staining,the authors demonstrated that these cells are parietal cells.HIP1R deficiency may cause excessive acid to be trapped in cells,leading to cell damage and even death.
HIPK1 participates in cell survival and apoptosis processes by binding to several regulators involved in cell survival,such as the anti-apoptotic transcription factors Brn3a5 and CtBP.

HIPK2 plays an important role in cell survival and proliferation,and its deficiency may lead to inhibition of these processes and increased apoptosis.HIPK2 knockdown increased the proportion of apoptosis in mouse fetal liver erythroid precursors and inhibited cell proliferation,accompanied by apoptotic and dead cells.

HMGB2 is related to apoptosis and participates in the regulation of cell apoptosis through the JNK1/2-NF-¦ÊB signaling pathway.HMGB2 participates in myocardial I/R-induced apoptosis,and its increased expression leads to increased cardiomyocyte apoptosis.This indicates that HMGB2 is related to apoptosis and involved in the regulation of myocardial I/R-induced cell apoptosis.

When cells are subjected to chronic reperfusion injury,HMOX1 may protect against cell apoptosis by inhibiting the expression of apoptotic regulators,thus exerting a protective effect on cells.After repeated ischemia/reperfusion,overexpression of HMOX1 can significantly reduce myocardial apoptosis (as confirmed by TUNEL staining,the number of TUNEL-positive cells in mouse myocardial cells undergoing repeated I/R is significantly reduced.

The methylation of Arginine 296 and 299 on HNRNPK inhibits nearby phosphorylation on Serine 302 mediated through the protein kinase C (PKC) pathway,thereby negatively regulating cell apoptosis.Mutations on Arginine 296 and 299 result in increased apoptosis and abolishing HNRNPK's anti-apoptotic roles.

HRAS regulates apoptosis by modulating the expression of TP53,which affects the survival and death of cells.Specifically,when HRAS signaling originates from the Golgi apparatus,TP53 is upregulated,which inhibits PDCD2 expression and protects the cell from apoptosis.

In human malignancies, aberrant methylation of specific promoter CpG islands causes the silencing of the HRK gene,which results in low apoptotic counts.HRK regulates Bcl-2 and Bcl-xL through selective interaction with the BH3 domain,contributing to apoptosis regulation in various cell types.

description: heat shock protein family A (Hsp70) member 1A
comment: HSPA1A participates in apoptosis mainly by increasing the anti-apoptotic ability of tumor cells.The specific mechanism is reflected in the activation of the NF-jB pathway induced by HSPA1A in tumor cells,reducing the expression of Bax,while increasing the ratio of Bcl-xL and Bcl-2 expression,which is more beneficial for the survival of tumor cells.

description: heat shock protein family A (Hsp70) member 1B
comment: HSP72 promotes cell survival during cellular stress and has been found to inhibit apoptosis in tumor cells induced by Fas.Specifically,Hsp72 inhibits Fas-induced apoptosis only in type II cells,and only when the intrinsic apoptosis pathway is required for efficient effector caspase activation.The article studied different pathways of apoptosis,explaining that the extrinsic apoptosis pathway is activated upon ligation of death receptors of the TNF1 receptor superfamily,while the intrinsic pathway,initiated by cellular stresses,activates pro-apoptotic members of the Bcl-2 family to target the mitochondria.

description: heat shock protein family B (small) member 1
comment: HSP27 inhibits multiple steps in the apoptotic pathway to prevent cell death.It binds to Daxx,blocking its interaction with Fas and Ask1 to inhibit apoptotic reactions.It also regulates the mitochondrial environment to prevent Bax activation and ROS generation.Additionally,HSP27 inhibits intrinsic apoptosis by preventing Bim degradation and can directly bind to mitochondrial proteins to inhibit cell death.

HTRA2,a mitochondrial serine protease,is released into the cytosol upon apoptotic stimulation,where it contributes to the regulation of programmed cell death.HTRA2 can bind to IAP proteins,releasing active caspases,and directly promote apoptosis by proteolytically degrading IAP proteins,the caspase-8 inhibitor phosphoprotein enriched in diabetes/phosphoprotein enriched in astrocytes (Ped/Pea-15) and the anti-apoptotic protein HAX-1.

HTT participates in apoptosis by inhibiting the activation of the mitochondrial pathway.In FD-induced cells,the expression of apoptosis-related proteins such as p53,Bax,cleaved caspase-9,cleaved PARP,caspase-3,and cytochrome c are upregulated.After HTT pretreatment,the expression of these proteins is suppressed.In addition,HTT can upregulate Bcl-2,Bcl-xL,and PARP,thereby enhancing the antioxidant capacity of cells and inhibiting apoptosis.

HYOU1 participates in apoptosis by inhibiting anti-death pathways in lung cancer cells and increasing cell death.In siRNA-mediated HYOU1 knockdown experiments,it was found that inhibiting HYOU1 expression in lung cancer MCTSs significantly increased the expression of cleaved PARP and cleaved caspase-3,promoting cell apoptosis.Through gene expression profiling of NCI-H460 cells,the researchers found that HYOU1 regulates cell apoptosis through interferon (IFN) signaling.

ICAM1 is an integrin on the surface of endothelial cells,closely related to leukocyte adhesion and chemotaxis,involved in immune-mediated inflammatory response.Inflammatory response often accompanies cell apoptosis.Neutrophil membrane-coated taurine nanoparticles can reduce the expression level of ICAM1 and alleviate the degree of inflammatory response and cell apoptosis in hepatic ischemia-reperfusion injury.

IFI16 participates in the biological process of apoptosis in skin cutaneous melanoma.IFI16 binds to p53 protein or downstream proteins,thereby activating the p53-related signaling pathway and inducing cell apoptosis.In cells with regular p53 activity,IFI16 inhibits NF-¦ÊB expression,activates apoptotic protein kinases,and promotes cell apoptosis,acting as a tumor suppressor gene.In tumor cells with p53 inactivated,IFI16 can activate NF-¦ÊB pathway,promote cell growth,and act as an oncogene.

IFI27 was found to be associated with cell apoptosis through a TRAIL-mediated pathway.The downregulation of IFI27 promoted HCT-8 cell apoptosis by regulating the expression of TRAIL and caspase-8.Additionally,overexpression of IFI27 enhanced TRAIL and caspase-8 expression,thereby promoting cell apoptosis.

The human ISG12 protein family, including ISG12A, ISG12B, ISG12C, and ISG6-16, induced by type 1 interferon, has the characteristic of promoting apoptosis. Among them, ISG6-16 promotes HCV replication and antagonizes TRAIL-induced apoptosis in gastric cancer and human myeloma cells. Therefore, it is speculated that ISG12B protein, encoded by IFI27L2, may also participate in the cell apoptosis process of diseases such as gastric cancer. The ISG12B protein encoded by IFI27L2 may mediate the mitochondrial apoptosis pathway by binding to the Bcl-2 protein as ISG12A does.

IFI6 participates in inhibiting the apoptosis of VECs during DENV infection.IFI6 expressed its anti-apoptotic function by inhibiting the mitochondrial-dependent pathway and regulating the expression of Bcl-2/Bax and the depolarization of the mitochondrial membrane potential.

IFNB1 is involved in apoptosis by activating both the intrinsic and extrinsic pathways.In MCF-7 breast cancer cells,IFNB1 can activate the intrinsic pathway by inducing CAS8 cleavage,BAX cleavage,and PARP1 cleavage.IFNB1 may also activate the extrinsic pathway by activating downstream CASP8 and CASP3/7 through death receptor activation.

Interferon gamma (IFN-¦Ã) is involved in apoptosis by stimulating TNF-dependent macrophage cytotoxicity.The authors used primary human eosinophils and effector cells in vitro and found that IFN-¦Ã stimulated eosinophils to activate TNF-dependent pathways by increasing the expression of TNFR1 in the cell membrane.This led to macrophage apoptosis.

IGF-1 injection can inhibit the apoptosis rate of plaque cells_nd IGF-1 can reduce cell death and DNA damage in plaques.In addition, IGF-1 is thought to inhibit oxidized lipid-induced smooth muscle cell apoptosis by activating the IGF-1 receptor.

description: inhibitor of nuclear factor kappa B kinase subunit epsilon
comment: IKBKE is related to Apoptosis by promoting the resistance of glioma cells to apoptosis through activating NF-¦ÊB. The authors showed that IKBKE mRNA and protein levels are up-regulated in glioma cell lines and human primary glioma tissues. Furthermore, up-regulation of IKBKE can induce the expression of Bcl-2 through activating NF-¦ÊB signalling.

IL12A is involved in apoptosis by regulating the formation of neutrophil extracellular traps.The experimental results show that the downregulation of IL12A can lead to the formation of neutrophil extracellular traps,resulting in increased cell apoptosis,while the upregulation of IL12A can inhibit apoptosis caused by miR-21 mimic.

IL-19 decreased the self-apoptosis caused by serum starvation in RA synovial cells through cell culture experiments and fluorescence microscopy observations. The phosphorylation of signal transducer and activator of transcription 3 (STAT3) was also used as an IL-19 signaling pathway for apoptosis regulation. Similarly, the externalization of annexin V-FITC and the colorimetric method for detecting the activity of caspase-3 also confirmed that IL-19 can inhibit cell apoptosis under serum starvation condition.

IL-1¦Á participates in apoptosis by being upregulated in response to ER stress-induced liver damage and deficiency of IL-1¦Á reduces ER stress-induced apoptosis and steatohepatitis.It has a dual function and can contribute to CHOP induction intracellularly or accelerate steatohepatitis by inducing inflammatory cytokines.The study concluded that IL-1¦Á plays a role in NASH pathogenesis by promoting ER stress-induced apoptosis.

IL1B is associated with apoptosis mediated by AIM2 inflammasome activation in alveolar epithelial cells.
