The results suggest that the persistently activated AIM2 molecule in the lungs of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) patients promotes lung inflammation and cell death, and IL1B is caused by this persistent activation.

The study examined the impact of IL-2 and IL-15 on Fas-mediated apoptosis of BAF-B03 pre-B cells, and found that, unlike IL-15, IL-2 cultured cells were prone to undergo apoptotic cell death upon cross-linking of the Fas receptor.

IL20RA is the receptor that mediates apoptosis when induced by IL-20 during myocardial ischemia/reperfusion (I/R) injury in this article. The study results suggest that IL-20 promotes oxidative stress and mitochondrial dysfunction in cardiomyocytes by activating the PKC/NADPH oxidase pathway, thereby increasing I/R injury-induced apoptosis and myocardial damage.

It has been found that IL33 prevents chemotherapy-induced apoptosis in tumor cells.Specifically, IL33 activates the JNK signaling pathway, leading to the binding of c-Jun to the promoters of core stem cell genes and the activation of core stem cell genes NANOG, NOTCH3, and OCT3/4. This promotes the stemness properties and resistance of cancer cells, and inhibits tumor cell apoptosis.

IL4 induces apoptosis of AML cells, manifested as a decrease in cell numbers and transcriptional profiles rich in apoptosis-related gene expression signatures. This effect is mediated by STAT6 phosphorylation, and disruption of STAT6 using genetic engineering renders cells partially resistant to IL4-induced apoptosis.

The expression of IL-6 receptor (IL6R) in multiple myeloma (MM) cells is closely related to cell survival and proliferation. The study found that EB1089 can downregulate the expression and production of gp80 (a subtype of IL6R) and induce apoptosis in MM cells, while other cytokines such as IL-6 can partially counteract the effects of EB1089. In addition, the combination of EB1089 and dexamethasone can increase the incidence of cell apoptosis.

The expression of interleukin 7 (IL-7) gene is closely related to apoptosis or programmed cell death in chronic B-lymphocytic leukemia (B-CLL) cells. The mRNA for IL-7 was present in leukemic cells from CLL patients, but when placed in culture, the gene expression was downregulated, leading to apoptosis._he study also suggests that regulation of both apoptosis and IL-7 gene expression can be mediated by cell-cell contact with endothelial cells, and the regulation of the apoptotic pathway via integrins results in perpetuating CLL cell viability and IL-7 gene expression.
ING2 was found to induce invasion of colorectal cancer cells and premature senescence in normal human fibroblast cells, as well as apoptosis or cell cycle arrest in various adherent cancer cells.

As a cofactor of Tip60,ING5 assists Tip60 in acetylating p53 at K120 and promotes the expression of p53-dependent apoptotic genes (BAX and GADD45) in response to DNA damage.The study found that ING5 expression was significantly increased and that ING5 formed a complex with p53 and Tip60,which promotes cells to choose between cell-cycle arrest and apoptosis.

INHBA is one of the main secreted proteins in ISL1-CM,and it has been shown to participate in the inhibition of STZ-induced INS-1 cell apoptosis.The research results showed that exogenous INHBA co-cultured with INS-1 cells inhibited sensitivity to STZ and increased cell survival rate.In addition,ISL1 can selectively bind to the three potential binding sites on the INHBA promoter,thereby regulating the ability of BMSCs to release INHBA.

The INHBB gene silencing through RNAi technology can significantly promote apoptosis in mouse granulosa cells.RNAi caused specific downregulation of INHBB,resulting in G1 phase arrest of the cell cycle and increase of apoptosis rate in GCs.Further studies have shown that INHBB is one of the key factors in the growth and development of mouse granulosa cells,which can regulate apoptosis and cell cycle progression,thereby affecting the biological activity of the ovaries through hormone secretion.

It was found that insulin biosynthesis is related to apoptosis in pancreatic ¦Â-cells through miR-25 and miR-92b.Through various experiments,it was found that miR-25 and miR-92b are upregulated in ¦Â-cells following exposure to inflammation and endoplasmic reticulum stressors,leading to reduced insulin biosynthesis and increased apoptosis.The interactions between miR-25/NEUROD1 and miR-25/MCL1 lead to reductions in insulin biosynthesis and increased ¦Â-cell apoptosis.

ITGA6 is associated with apoptosis through regulating the Src signaling pathway and the expression of the IAP family member survivin.It was found that the anti-human ¦Á6-blocking antibody P5G10 can induce apoptosis in primary ALL cells,sensitizing ALL cells to chemotherapy or tyrosine kinase inhibition in vitro and in vivo.Using a conditional knockout mouse model of ¦Á6,it was further demonstrated that ¦Á6 knockdown induces apoptosis.
The study found that ITGAM significantly decreased tubular apoptosis and mitigated kidney damage in neonatal mice with unilateral ureteral obstruction (UUO).

The upregulation of miR-217-5p levels is involved in the induction of cell apoptosis by indirectly regulating the expression of ITGAV.By inhibiting luciferase activity in reporter constructs containing miR-217-5p binding sites in the 3' untranslated region,we found that miR-217-5p indirectly regulates the expression of PRKCI, BAG3, ITGAV, and MAPK1.

The study found that disrupting the expression of ITM2C by expressing antisense RNA of ITM2C promoted resistance to TNF-induced cell death by more than 1000-fold in L929 cells, suggesting the involvement of ITM2C in TNF-induced cell death. However, the effect of ITM2C antisense RNA on cell death caused by other apoptotic inducers was found to be highly specific to TNF-induced cell death, indicating that ITM2C plays an important role in TNF-induced cell death specifically. Additionally, overexpression of ITM2C induced apoptosis in L929 cells.

ITPR1 was robustly elevated in endometriosis lesions.Knockdown of ITPR1 reduced cell proliferation and induced apoptosis in HESCs.In addition,candidate drugs such as Camptothecin effectively suppressed HESC proliferation and induced apoptosis,while also reducing ITPR1 expression.

The ITPRIP-DAPK1 interaction is one of the important molecular mechanisms that affect glioma progression.ITPRIP promotes glioma progression by inhibiting the tumor suppressor death-associated protein kinase 1 (DAPK1) through linking MYL9.DAPK1 plays an important role in promoting cell death, preventing oncogenic transformation,and tumor cell migration,and ITPRIP affects radioresistance induced by high glucose by inhibiting DAPK1 activity.DAPK1 has a C-terminal death domain (DD) involved in regulating apoptosis.

Over-expression of IVNS1ABP in ESCC cells significantly enhanced their response to radiotherapy in vitro.In vivo,over-expression of IVNS1ABP could promote the apoptosis of ESCC cells after radiotherapy,and apoptosis is one of the main cell death mechanisms after radiotherapy.In addition,down-regulation of IVNS1ABP will block cells from entering into apoptosis,thus enhancing the radioresistance of ESCC cells.

JAK2 plays a role in apoptosis in this paper by inhibiting the signaling pathway that induces cell death and regulating the Bim protein.Moreover,JAK2 inhibition-induced apoptosis is correlated with upregulation of the nonphosphorylated form of Bim.Additionally,the BH3 mimetic ABT-737 can enhance JAK2 inhibition-induced apoptosis and reduce the number of erythroid colonies derived from CD34 cells isolated from patients with myeloproliferative disorders.

description: junction mediating and regulatory protein, p53 cofactor
comment: JMY enhances p53 transcriptional activity by forming a complex with p300/CREB,leading to activation of apoptosis.When there is DNA damage, the level of JMY increases,forming a complex with ASPP and Strap to increase the ability of p53 to induce apoptosis.

description: Jun proto-oncogene, AP-1 transcription factor subunit
comment: JUN plays an important regulatory role in the process of neuronal apoptosis.In neurons,the JNK/c-Jun signaling pathway is considered to be a key pathway that promotes cellular apoptosis.Research has shown that when neurons face a lack of survival factors or exposure to excitotoxins such as kainic acid,the JNK/c-Jun pathway triggers the process of cellular apoptosis.In the organism,the absence of Jnk3 leads to apoptosis of hippocampal neurons following injection of kainic acid,while Jnk1 and Jnk2 have been shown to play an important role in promoting cellular apoptosis during neural tube development in embryos.

KDM1A inhibitors induce apoptosis of GSCs, and in in vivo studies,it was found that oral administration of KDM1A inhibitors significantly inhibited tumor growth of GSCs and improved the survival of mice.The study also shows that KDM1A inhibitors induce the activation of the UPR pathway which is closely related to cell apoptosis.

MiR-34c promotes apoptosis of colorectal cancer cells by down-regulating KITLG expression.Overexpression of miR-34c could reduce cell proliferation and increase cell apoptosis rate.After reverse operation using KITLG-specific siRNA,KITLG expression was significantly decreased,and cell proliferation and invasive capacity were inhibited,while cell apoptosis rate was increased.

KRT18 is associated with apoptosis by being cleaved into ccK-18 through the action of caspase,which is mediated by apoptosis. ccK-18 can be detected in the blood to measure the degree of apoptosis.At the same time,KRT18 can also be released into circulation as an early biomarker of cell death.

The role of Keratin 8 in apoptosis is to resist the destruction of cellular components.This is particularly evident in TNF and Fas-mediated apoptosis.It is noteworthy that several epithelial cell lines deficient in Keratin 8/K18 IF are more sensitive to apoptosis induced by TNF and cycloheximide.This resistance to TNF is correlated with the ability of K8 to bind with the cytoplasmic domain of TNF receptors.

description: LCK proto-oncogene, Src family tyrosine kinase
comment: LCK deficiency leads to cell-cycle arrest at the G2 phase in T cells.Moreover,LCK-deficient cells display hypersensitivity to T cell receptor activation-induced apoptosis,which can be reversed by T cell growth factors.Therefore, LCK is required for cell-cycle progression through the G2-M checkpoint in mature T lymphocytes.Meanwhile,LCK deficiency can cause defects in T lymphocyte cell cycle and hypersusceptibility to apoptosis.

Overexpression of LGALS12 can lead to G1 cell cycle arrest and apoptosis.Some studies have shown that LGALS12 deficiency can increase insulin sensitivity and glucose tolerance in obese animals,while its expression in adipocytes promotes apoptosis.

LGALS3 has opposing effects on cell death depending on whether it is located inside or outside the cell.It is anti-apoptotic when within the cell and pro-apoptotic when outside the cell.There is no direct evidence to support the anti-apoptotic activity of extracellular LGALS3, but its binding to proteins such as the CD95 receptor may be one of the important mechanisms that mediate its pro-apoptotic activity.The anti-apoptotic role of LGALS3 is mainly achieved by preventing mitochondrial damage and inhibiting cytochrome c release,thus down-regulating the activity of caspases.

Neurons expressing Parkinsonism-associated mutant forms of LRRK2 undergo apoptosis.In addition,mutant LRRK2 is also associated with the aggregation of phosphorylated tau protein,which is also a pathological feature related to neuronal apoptosis.

Therapeutic inhibition of LT¦ÂR signalling disrupted inducible bronchus-associated lymphoid tissue and induced regeneration of lung tissue.Therefore,inhibition of LT¦ÂR signalling could represent a viable therapeutic option that combines prevention of tertiary lymphoid structures and inhibition of apoptosis with tissue-regenerative strategies.LT¦ÂR-Ag and TNF can induce cell death of lung epithelial cells but using cells without LT¦ÂR can partially restore wound regeneration in the lung.

The expression of LY96 was significantly decreased in thyroid tumors of ThrbPV/PVPten+/- mice.Insufficient apoptosis of immature tumor cells is an important factor in tumor progression.Other studies have also shown that LY96 can be prepared through biosynthesis technology to reverse induce tumor cell apoptosis and has potential anti-tumor activity.

MADD (IG20) is a pro-apoptotic protein that is related to TNF-¦Á,TRAIL,and other molecular pathways,and can enhance TRAIL-induced apoptosis.IG20 can enhance the activation of caspases in the death-inducing signaling complex (DISC),and the recruitment of FADD and caspase-8 to the DISC,thereby facilitating DISC formation.The study showed that IG20 interacts with TRAIL death receptors and increases the colocalization of FADD and caspase-8 with DISC,thereby enhancing TRAIL-induced apoptosis.

MAEL promotes tumor cell growth and inhibits cell apoptosis in ESCC.Specifically, MAEL upregulates interleukin-8 (IL8) through the Akt1/RelA pathway,which then attracts immunosuppressive cells from the bone marrow to the tumor site.

Overexpression of MAGEA3 was associated with an increase in the number of malignant cells with Ki-67 positive.Further experiments have shown that although MAGEA does not affect the cell cycle,it is necessary for the survival of proliferating myeloma cells.Loss of MAGEA induces cell apoptosis by activating proapoptotic protein Bax through p53-dependent mechanism and reducing survivin expression through p53-dependent and independent mechanisms.

Through the expression of activators or inhibitors of MAP2K5,the researchers used the fetal thymic organ culture and hematopoietic stem cell reconstitution system to prove the crucial role of MAP2K5 in TCR-mediated apoptosis.In addition,they also showed the relationship between ERK5 activity and Nur77 family members,emphasizing the differential effects of the MAPK network on T-cell differentiation and apoptosis.

MAP3K5 (ASK1) was found to be a MAP kinase kinase kinase (MAPKKK) in mammals that can activate two different subgroups of MAP kinase kinases (MAPKK) and play a key role in stress- and cytokine-induced apoptosis.Overexpression of ASK1 induces apoptotic cell death and it is activated in cells treated with tumor necrosis factor-¦Á (TNF-¦Á).

Silenced MAPK7 gene has an important impact on cell death by increasing caspase gene expression.At the same time,the article also mentions that targeting inhibition of the MAPK7 gene may enhance the effectiveness of known chemotherapy drugs.

Through activating the MAPK8/JNK pathway mediated by TRAF2 and RIPK1,TNFSF10/TRAIL-induced autophagy reduces the cytotoxicity of TNFSF10.In addition,MAPK8-mediated autophagy also promotes TNFSF10-induced apoptosis by degrading BCL2L1 and reducing the formation of the BCL2L1-BECN1 complex.

MAPK8IP1 (JIP1) is involved in the regulation of apoptosis by interacting with the Notch1 signaling pathway.By suppressing the interaction between Notch1-IC and RBP-Jk,JIP1 negatively regulates the transactivation of Notch1-IC and affects cell fate decisions,differentiation,and apoptosis processes involved in the Notch1 signaling pathway.

Taiwanin A induced programmed cell death through the JNK and p38 MAPK pathways,with JNK being the kinase that phosphorylates Bcl-2.Phosphorylation of Bcl-2 is believed to inhibit its anti-apoptotic activity and enhance cytotoxicity.Silencing the expression of the JNK scaffold protein MAPK8IP2 can inhibit Taiwanin A-induced apoptosis.

MAPK9 plays a crucial role in regulating thymocyte apoptosis and T cell activation,and is associated with molecular effectors such as c-Jun and activated nuclear factor of activated T cells (NF-AT).The JNK signaling pathway is activated in response to T cell antigen receptor (TCR) ligation,and phosphorylates and modifies the activity of transcription factors,including c-Jun and NF-AT, which regulate T cell-specific target genes such as IL-2.MAPK9 appears to play an important role in thymocyte apoptosis, possibly partially mediating it through c-Jun N-terminal phosphorylation.

MARCH7 regulates Apoptosis-related properties of cells by affecting the MDM2-p53 pathway.MARCH7 interacts with MDM2 and promotes MDM2-dependent degradation of p53,thereby regulating cell proliferation,anchorage-independent cell growth,and apoptosis in a p53-dependent manner.MARCH7 regulates cell proliferation and DNA damage-induced apoptosis in a p53-dependent manner.
Lowering levels of MAZ can aid in inducing cell death and prohibiting the growth of hepatocellular carcinoma cells, as evidenced by analyzing cell cycle and apoptosis through flow cytometry.

description: MCL1 apoptosis regulator, BCL2 family member
comment: As an anti-apoptotic protein,MCL1 plays a critical role in delaying apoptosis during mitosis.MCL1 is gradually degraded during mitosis,reducing its anti-apoptotic function.The article reveals the molecular basis of BCL-2 family members that may be involved in promoting apoptotic signals during mitosis and discusses the controversy surrounding ubiquitin ligases related to MCL1 degradation.The experiment shows that MARCH5 regulates mitotic apoptosis through MCL1-dependent and -independent mechanisms,respectively.It determines whether MCL1 has anti-apoptotic function by determining the initial level of MCL1 when entering mitosis and the duration of MCL1 presence during mitotic arrest.

MDM2 promotes the ubiquitylation and degradation of the p53 proapoptotic activator HIPK2,leading to the repression of p53's Ser46 phosphorylation and apoptosis,even in response to non-severe DNA damage that can be reversed through growth-arresting stimuli.This repression is achieved through an active p53-induced,MDM2-mediated inhibition of the p53 apoptotic pathways,leading to the suppression of the apoptosis-specific p53 posttranslational modification at Ser46.

MELK is associated with apoptosis by inducing pyroptosis through other forms of cell death.OTSSP167,a MELK inhibitor,promotes swelling characterized by the typical pyrototic morphology of large bubbles from the plasma membrane in H1299 cells and elongated intercellular bridges of H1975 cells,when these cell lines are treated with the treatment.This could induce pyroptosis through Caspase-3/7-induced activation of GSDME rather than GSDMD.

The complex formed by MFF and VDAC1 can regulate the morphology and size of mitochondria,and is also related to apoptosis.The experimental results showed that cell death can be induced in drug-resistant melanoma cells by disrupting the MFF-VDAC1 complex,but had no effect on normal cells.In addition,the study also found a direct link between the protein isoforms of MFF and effectors of organelle cell death,specifically in cancer.

ICBP90 and GR participate in the formation of a 3-protein transcription factor complex at the MIF-794 CATT5-8 promoter,which elevates MIF expression to reduce apoptotic signaling.The relationship between MIF expression level and apoptosis exhibits a bell-shaped dose-response curve,where high concentrations of hormones can reduce MIF expression and promote apoptosis.The anti-apoptotic effect of MIF is achieved through the regulation of Akt and Bcl-2 expression,and differences in genes such as ICBP90 and MIF can lead to cell apoptosis or promote MIF's protective effect.

MIR132 is related to apoptosis through modulating the apoptotic process in cardiomyocytes.MIR132 can play an anti-apoptotic role by activating the phosphatidylinositol-3 kinase/protein kinase B pathway in cardiomyocytes.

MIR15A is related to apoptosis by inducing or inhibiting cell apoptosis.MIR15A overexpression can induce cell apoptosis,while MIR15A inhibition can increase cell proliferation and decrease cell apoptosis.MIR15A induces or inhibits cell apoptosis by regulating the expression of proteins such as GSK-3B,Bax,and caspase 3.

Low expression of MIR15A and MIR16-1 may lead to an increase in the expression level of the anti-apoptotic protein Bcl-2,thus inhibiting the process of apoptosis.This is because MIR15A and MIR16-1 can suppress the expression of Bcl-2,leading to an increase in the survival rate of tumor cells which eventually develop into CLL.

MIR17 plays an important role in regulating apoptosis,and can also regulate cellular lifespan and senescence through its pleiotropic effects.Overexpression of miR-17 can inhibit cellular senescence and increase the lifespan of mice.In addition,miR-17 further inhibits cellular senescence and apoptosis by regulating the expression of the MKP7 gene.

The relationship between MIR198 and apoptosis is related to promoting or inhibiting cell apoptosis and increasing cell resistance to chemotherapy drugs in gastric cancer cells.CircAKT3 enhances PIK3R1 expression by sponging miR-198,which inhibits cell apoptosis and increases the resistance of gastric cancer cells to cisplatin.In addition,significant downregulation of miR-198 is associated with a decrease in apoptosis of gastric cancer cells.

MIR21 inhibits podocyte death by suppressing pro-apoptotic signals.TGFB1 can regulate the expression of MIR21 and suppress cell apoptosis by inhibiting the expression of BH3-only genes and promoting AKT activation. Under the stimulation of signals.TGFB1, transfection of MIR21 mimic in mouse podocytes can alleviate podocyte apoptosis.

MIR210 is closely related to the development of atherosclerosis through its role in promoting endothelial cell apoptosis.The high-fat diet upregulates MIR210 by directly targeting PDK1,inducing cell apoptosis in endothelial cells and promoting the development of atherosclerosis.

MIR221 inhibits cell apoptosis by targeting pro-apoptotic gene PUMA,thereby reducing apoptosis.Studies have shown that in human glioma cells,miR-221/222 reduce PUMA protein levels by targeting PUMA-3¡¯UTR,leading to cell survival. Introducing PUMA cDNA without 3¡äUTR abrogated miR-221/222-induced cell survival.On the other hand,knockdown of miR-221/222 induces PUMA expression and significantly reduces cell apoptosis,which can significantly decrease tumor growth in xenograft model.

MIR222 regulates apoptosis in glioblastoma and may be potential therapeutic targets for cancer treatment.MIR-222 reduces PUMA protein levels by targeting PUMA-3'UTR, thereby inhibiting apoptosis and promoting cell survival in human glioblastoma cells. Injection of As-miR-221/222 can reduce tumor growth and induce cell apoptosis.

MIR26B inhibits the expression of the NF-¦ÊB pathway in hepatocellular carcinoma and is involved in the process of apoptosis.MIR26B can increase the sensitivity of HCC to doxorubicin by inhibiting the TNF¦Á- and doxorubicin-activated NF-¦ÊB signaling pathway via targeting TAK1 and TAB3.In HCC cell lines,the introduction of MIR26B can inhibit the phosphorylation of I¦ÊB¦Á and p65,block the nuclear translocation of NF-¦ÊB,reduce NF-¦ÊB reporter activity,and abrogate the expression of NF-¦ÊB target genes.Conversely, the antagonism of MIR26B transfection in HCC cells reduced apoptosis rate.

MIR27B can prevent apoptosis by reducing the expression of caspase-3 and Bax/Bcl-2 ratio.Experiments have shown that MIR27B can alleviate mitochondrial oxidative stress and inflammation caused by TNF-¦Á in endothelial cells,thus preventing apoptosis.

It has been shown that miR-449a can inhibit HCC cell proliferation and induce apoptosis.Additionally,miR-449a can attenuate TGF-¦Â signaling in cancer cells,thereby further inhibiting their migration ability.

Overexpression of MKNK2 can lead to ROS accumulation,an increase in MDA levels,and an increase in apoptosis in cardiomyocytes after high glucose stimulation.In the MAPK pathway,MKNK2 is one of its substrates and is expressed at high levels in various cancers.There are two isoforms of MKNK2 in humans,MKNK2A and MKNK2B.In vitro studies have shown that MKNK2A can activate the p38-MAPK pathway to induce apoptosis,while MKNK2B does not have this effect.

In addition to its role in DNA mismatch repair (MMR),MMR proteins can bind to certain DNA lesions and signal p53 and apoptosis by an unknown mechanism.It was found that alkylating agents induced both apoptosis and phosphorylation of the Ser-15 site of p53 in a MLH1-dependent manner,while induction of apoptosis,but not p53 phosphorylation,was MLH1 dependent following treatment with H2O2.Both alkylating agents and H2O2 caused significant inhibition of mRNA synthesis in MLH1-expressing but not in MLH1-deficient cells,suggesting a novel mechanism of MLH1 in inducing p53 and apoptosis by inhibiting RNA polymerase II-dependent transcription on damaged DNA templates.

MLLT11 is suggested as one of the mediators of apoptosis in ovarian cancer cells.4-HPR treatment enhances MLLT11 expression in cancer cells sensitive to the retinoid and that such upregulation is an important event of the 4-HPR signaling cascade that leads to apoptosis.Finally,by MLLT11 overexpression,the article demonstrates a role of MLLT11 in the onset of basal apoptosis in ovarian cancer cells.

MMP9 mediates apoptosis in high-glucose-induced cardiac stem cell death.Studies have shown that MMP9 is one of the mediators of oxidative stress induced by hyperglycemia,leading to the death of cardiac stem cells.The authors' experiments using CRISPR-Cas9 technology verified the absence of MMP9 in MMP9-/- cardiac stem cells.The results show that MMP9 promotes cell death in hyperglycemic cardiac stem cells via both apoptosis and pyroptosis,and that the absence of MMP9 improves cell viability.

Deletion of MNT using Rag1Cre in lymphoid progenitor cells increases the expression of pro-apoptotic BH3-only protein BIM,leading to enhanced apoptosis during normal T cell development.Additionally,loss of MNT reduces the pool of pre-malignant MYC-driven T lymphoid cells and inhibits thymic T lymphomagenesis in T lymphoma-prone VavP-MYC transgenic mice.MNT deletion also prevents T lymphoma development in ¦Ã-irradiated mice by increasing apoptosis of T lymphoid cells.

MOAP1 interacts with the significant apoptosis regulator BAX and regulates genes involved in cellular apoptosis.MOAP1 plays a critical role in mitochondrial-dependent apoptosis and is associated with various diseases such as cancers and neurological diseases.

description: MPV17 mitochondrial inner membrane protein like
comment: MPV17L protects mitochondria against ROS-induced mitochondrial dysfunction and cell apoptosis.When the expression of MPV17L is reduced,the mitochondrial membrane potential decreases,and cell apoptosis increases.Induction of mitochondrial ROS generation downregulates MPV17L via a ROS-dependent mechanism.Also,it has been found that MPV17L can directly interact with HtrA2 protein and activate its protease activity,which can inhibit mitochondrial superoxide generation,stabilize mitochondrial membrane potential,and prevent apoptosis.

MSH2 is a key element involved in the DNA mismatch repair system responsible for recognizing and repairing mispaired bases.Additionally,MSH2 is involved in the recognition of DNA adducts induced by temozolomide (TMZ),which triggers apoptosis and autophagy in tumor cells.

After UV-B induced DNA damage, the level of MSH6 protein increases,promoting apoptosis.Cells with MSH6 deficiency are less sensitive to UV-B radiation cytotoxicity and undergo less apoptosis after irradiation.This suggests that UV-B induced apoptosis is partially dependent on MSH6 protein levels.

MSX1 can induce G0/G1 arrest and apoptosis in cervical cancer cells by inhibiting Notch signaling.In HeLa cells expressing MSX1,G0/G1 arrest in the cell cycle is significantly increased,and the expression of cleaved PARP and cleaved caspase-3 is strongly upregulated,suggesting that MSX1 can also induce cell death by increasing the expression of molecular markers of apoptosis.

In some cases,MUC1 promotes cancer cell growth and survival,while in other cases,MUC1 can inhibit cell apoptosis.For example,MUC1-C can inhibit stress-induced apoptosis and promote the growth and survival of pancreatic cancer cells.On the other hand,knockdown of MUC1 can inhibit cell proliferation,enhance cell-cell aggregation,and induce cell apoptosis.

MUL1 can have different functions of promoting or inhibiting apoptosis,depending on the interaction of its specific substrate.Under the mediation of MUL1,DRP1 is the central substrate for MUL1-mediated SUMOylation,which plays a major role in programmed cell death.However,when interacting with other proteins,such as the tumor suppressor p53,MUL1 promotes ubiquitination and downregulates mitochondrial p53,inhibiting apoptosis.
MYBBP1A promotes the degradation of the p53 protein in the nucleolus,but it also enhances p53 activity by promoting p300-mediated p53 acetylation,thereby promoting apoptosis.
NACC2 is a subtype of TRKs overexpressed in gastric and lung cancers.The article also suggests that NACC family members play an essential role in regulating neuronal apoptosis.

NANOS3 is related to apoptosis by protecting embryonic germ cells from cell death,which remains even after the germ cells enter the gonad.There is a checkpoint for germ cell viability at an early stage of embryonic development (E13.5),and NANOS3 mRNA expression stops after E13.5 in female germ cells,thus their successful meiotic entry may protect them from continued apoptosis.However,in male germ cells,NANOS2 expression is associated with cell death at this stage and NANOS3 can only function in male germ cells in the presence of NANOS2.

NBN gene defects can lead to apoptosis of brain nerve cells.The NBN gene is associated with the ATM and p53 pathways,and the ATM and p53 response to DNA double-strand breaks is crucial.When the NBN gene is inactivated in mouse neural tissues, similar to typical neurological abnormalities of AT, ATLD, and NBS, including growth retardation,microcephaly,cerebellar defects,and ataxia would be caused.Meanwhile,there is a significant increase in cell apoptosis in NBN-CNS-del cerebella,and the phosphorylation level of p53 is significantly increased,and the expression level of p21 is significantly increased.

Studies have shown that NCK1 can accumulate in the nucleus after DNA damage and inhibit the phosphorylation of p53,thereby preventing apoptosis from occurring.However,both NCK1 and NCK2 can accumulate in the nucleus after DNA damage,and their depletion leads to increased phosphorylation of p53 and apoptosis.Therefore,NCK1 and NCK2 may have overlapping functions after DNA damage,and can regulate the occurrence of apoptosis.

NCK2 is related to apoptosis,as its depletion leads to premature cell death following DNA damage.Although NCK1 and NCK2 have redundant functions in this aspect,the research found that the loss of NCK2 more significantly activated caspases and promoted apoptosis.

NDUFA13 has a regulatory effect on apoptosis.It has been found that a moderate down-regulation of NDUFA13 can provide cell protection against apoptosis through the use of reactive oxygen species (ROS) as a second messenger,ultimately reducing superoxide burst and decreasing infarct size during ischemia-reperfusion (I/R) injury.In addition,down-regulated NDUFA13 resulted in the activation of STAT3 signaling,which has been shown to increase survival in tumor cells.

NDUFS3 plays a role in apoptosis by regulating the production of reactive oxygen species (ROS) in MRC complex I.IFN-b and RA have synergistic apoptotic effects in cancer treatment,but the mechanism of action is unclear.The study found that IFN-b/RA upregulates the expression of MRC complex subunits,including NDUFS3,which modulate ROS production and late gene expression,leading to cell death.Knockdown of NDUFS3 leads to a decrease in ROS production and apoptosis in cancer cell lines.The MRC is essential for apoptosis,regulating ROS production and cytochrome c release.

description: nuclear factor of activated T cells 4
comment: When cochlear hair cells were challenged by ototoxic drugs or noise exposure,NFATC4 was activated,translocated into the nucleus,enhanced the expression of TNF and its downstream targets, leading to hair cell apoptosis.Meanwhile, NFATC4-deficient hair cells were less sensitive to ototoxic drugs and noise exposure compared to wild type controls.The TNF-mediated apoptosis pathway was attenuated in NFATC4-deficient cochlear epithelium.

NFE2L2 is a transcription factor associated with regulation of genes involved with antioxidant response to cellular stress,such as exposure to radiation,oxidative stress and cytotoxic chemicals.Meanwhile,NFE2L2 is a key regulatory gene of proteasome function,which in turn affects the development of T-cell leukemia/lymphoma.In addition,inhibiting the proteasome can increase the expression of an inhibitor of NF-KB and protein accumulation, thereby activating the NF-KB pathway and inducing apoptosis.

In prostate and colon cancer cells, NGF receptors and androgens can regulate apoptosis.Testosterone can exert pro-apoptotic effects in prostate and colon cancer cells through a membrane-initiated mechanism,while DHEA can activate NGF receptors,thus regulating cell fate.DHEA activates both TrkA and p75NTR receptors,while ineffective testosterone enhances cell apoptosis,inhibiting the prosurvival effects of NGF and DHEA,and antagonizing their ability to activate TrkA and p75NTR.

NGFR can regulate the death of many tumor cells,including autophagy and apoptosis.In various tumors,NGFR plays a role in regulating cell growth,invasion,metastasis,autophagy,and apoptosis.However, the response of different types of cells to NGFR varies depending on the cell type and differentiation status.

NKX3-1 can promote the apoptosis process of prostate cancer cells induced by TNF-a and CHX.In addition,the study also found that NKX3-1 can increase the expression and activity of Caspase-3,thereby enhancing the sensitivity of prostate cancer cells to apoptosis inducers.

The loss of NLE1 leads to an increase in apoptosis in tumor cells.By generating NLE1-deficient human colonic epithelial cell lines and IGF2BP1-overexpressing HCT116 cell lines using CRISPR/Cas9 editing technology,NLE1 deficiency resulted in cell cycle arrest and failure to progress towards G1 or G2 phases of the cell cycle and increased proportion of cells undergoing apoptosis.Under some conditions,such as TP53-deficient cell lines,this increase in apoptosis is further enhanced.

NME5 can attenuate gemcitabine-induced apoptosis.In samples and cell lines with high expression of NME5 in human pancreatic cancer,NME5 can inhibit gemcitabine-induced cell cycle arrest and apoptosis,leading to a lower sensitivity of the cells to gemcitabine.

NMT1 plays an important role in neutrophil apoptosis.The study found that NMT1 expression increased in activated neutrophils and knockdown of NMT1 promoted spontaneous death of neutrophils.This finding indicates that NMT1 has a significant role in regulating neutrophil lifespan.

description: NOC2 like nucleolar associated transcriptional repressor
comment: NOC2L plays a key role in skin development,and its loss in epidermal cells prevents proliferation and promotes programmed cell death.It has been found in a previous study that NOC2L can interact with the tumor suppressor gene p53 and that the level of p53 acetylation increases after NOC2L is removed.

NOG plays a crucial role in regulating apoptosis in BMP2-induced osteoblasts,and reduced expression of NOG led to increased apoptosis in osteoblasts,indicating a relationship between NOG and osteoblast survival.

Apoptosis repressor with caspase recruitment domain (ARC),encoded by NOL3,is an anti-apoptotic protein that can inhibit cell apoptosis in various tissues.In this study, the researchers found that loss of the Nol3 gene led to the development of MPN in mice, characterized by enhanced cell proliferation and activation of tumor-related genes.In addition,this study found that NOL3 expression levels were decreased in a subset of patients with myeloid malignancies.

Knockdown/deficiency of NONO significantly increases cell apoptosis,including early apoptosis and late apoptosis,and the apoptosis is mediated by the activation of caspase-3 and then led to PARP binding to target DNA.Meanwhile,Polypyrimidine tract-binding protein (PTB) is critical in apoptosis.HNRNPA1 decreases in association with PTB and NONO interferes with the association between HNRNPA1 and PTB.This results in the stabilization of HNRNPA1,which accelerates apoptosis rates by changing gene expression at the post-transcriptional level.

Overexpression of NOS3 can lead to neuronal apoptosis.Overexpression of NOS3 can cause an increase in the levels of several proteins,including p53, p21/Waf1,Bax,and CD95,which leads to mitochondrial dysfunction and an increase in cellular oxidative stress levels.These adverse effects are related to the instability of the endoplasmic reticulum and even the cell membrane,rather than directly related to the synthesis of NO.

NOX1 can suppress the acetylation modification of p53 by interacting with SIRT1,thus inhibiting the apoptotic function of p53.NOX1 is an enzyme that generates superoxide and H2O2,and overexpression is involved in the control of NOX1 activity by regulatory components in fibroblasts.The upregulation of NOX1 expression is associated with the suppression of p53's apoptotic function.The downregulation of NOX1 can activate the apoptotic function of p53.

description: nuclear receptor subfamily 4 group A member 2
comment: NR4A2 exhibits apoptosis suppression effects in both non-transformed HeLaHF revertant cells and experimental cancer cell lines. The downregulation of NR4A2 results in cells losing their ability to grow without adhesion and causes an increase in anoikis. Meanwhile, the downregulation of NR4A2 and NR4A1 also promotes intrinsic apoptosis.

NUPR1 is involved in apoptosis pathway by regulating the generation of ROS after radiation injury.The apoptosis level was significantly reduced in HCC cells with NUPR1 overexpression or HGPRT stable mutant,compared with control group.More PARP and cleaved caspase-3 were detected by Western blot.

OPA1 is related to apoptosis, mainly by maintaining the mitochondrial cristae structure.When the mitochondrial cristae undergo remodeling,OPA1 is cleaved by the rhomboid protease PARL into short forms,which dissolve in the mitochondrial cristae and maintain the bottleneck configuration,thereby controlling the release of cytochrome c during apoptosis.

The expression of P2RX4 increases in glioblastoma cells,and blocking P2RX4 expression can inhibit the growth and proliferation of glioblastoma cells while promoting apoptosis.When the expression of P2RX4 is silenced,it inhibits the BDNF/TrkB signaling pathway,thereby inhibiting the expression of activated transcription factor 4 (ATF4).This indicates that P2RX4 plays a crucial role in cell apoptosis in the BDNF/TrkB/ATF4 signaling pathway.

P2RX7 can induce cell apoptosis and play an anticancer role by regulating the expression of apoptosis-related proteins CASP8,CASP9,and CASP3.In UBUC patients,P2RX7 protein levels are positively correlated with EMP2 protein levels,and low P2RX7 protein levels are associated with poor disease-specific and metastasis-free survival.

P4HB is involved in promoting stress-induced apoptosis and muscle atrophy. EVs derived from esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC) contain P4HB, which is a critical mediator of muscle wasting, and P4HB's overexpression can promote hepatocellular carcinoma cell growth and epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition (EMT). Treatment with a P4HB inhibitor prevents cell apoptosis, improves body weight loss, and ameliorates muscle wasting in mice.

PAK2 has a dual role in cell apoptosis.The full-length PAK2 can inhibit negative apoptotic signals by phosphorylating BAD,thus preventing cell apoptosis.However,the C-terminal cleavage product of PAK2 is a constitutively active PAK2-p34 that can stimulate programmed cell death.The activation of PAK2 and cell survival are limited by the amplitude of the applied force,with low-amplitude physiological forces protecting PAK2 from proteolytic degradation to ensure cell survival,while high-amplitude forces expose PAK2 and stimulate apoptosis.
PAK5 is related to apoptosis by inhibiting AIF from entering the nucleus, thus reducing AIF nuclear translocation and alleviating apoptosis.

PARK7 is an antioxidant protein that can enhance cell resistance to oxidative stress and stress-induced apoptosis, clear excessive reactive oxygen species, maintain mitochondrial function, and inhibit stress-induced apoptosis.
PARP1 plays an important role in regulating cell apoptosis, and overactivation can deplete cellular energy and induce apoptosis.

PARP2 controls the lifespan of red blood cells and affects whether immature red blood cells enter the apoptotic pathway after DNA damage. The researchers found that PARP2 deficiency leads to a shortened lifespan of erythrocytes, impaired differentiation of erythroid progenitors, and replicative stress, limiting the expansion of red blood cells.

PAWR is a protein that regulates cell apoptosis by importing Bax and Bad to mitochondria.PAWR induces cancer cell apoptosis through p53- and PTEN-independent pathways and is a potential target for cancer therapy.

PCGF2 mediates proliferation, migration, and invasion of melanoma cells and inhibits apoptosis by downregulating the expression of miR-1306-5p. Upregulation of miR-1306-5p can suppress proliferation, migration, and invasion of melanoma cells, promote apoptosis, and its mechanism of action is to target and regulate the expression of the PCGF2 gene.

PDCD10 plays an important role in regulating cell apoptosis, and can either inhibit or promote cell apoptosis under different conditions, subject to the regulation of the body. In the study, overexpression of PDCD10 inhibited apoptosis in osteosarcoma cells while activating the EMT pathway, thus promoting the proliferation, migration, and invasion of osteosarcoma cells, which is negatively correlated with the inhibition of cell apoptosis.

PDCD5 is a tumor suppressor that plays a positive role in p53-mediated apoptosis. PDCD5 forms a complex with Tip60 to promote the acetylation of p53 at the Lys-120 site, thus promoting the cell's response to DNA damage. In addition, PDCD5 also interacts with BAX to mediate the release of cytochrome C.

Studies have found that PDCD6 is a novel p53-responsive gene that can accumulate in the nucleus after DNA damage and induce cell apoptosis. Knockdown of the PDCD6 gene suppresses p53-dependent apoptosis, cytochrome c release, and the cleavage of PARP by caspase-3. In addition, the study also found that PDCD6 may be involved in calcium-dependent apoptosis.

description: protein disulfide isomerase family A member 3
comment: Studies have shown that PDIA3 has a pro-apoptotic function in apoptotic signaling by inducing mitochondrial outer membrane permeabilization (MOMP) through activating Bak. In addition, reducing PDIA3 expression can alleviate apoptotic signaling, while increasing PDIA3 expression intensifies apoptotic signaling.

PDK1 is involved in regulating neuronal survival during cortical development.PDK1 deficiency leads to neuron loss and increased apoptosis in the cortex of mice.PDK1, together with c-Jun N-terminal kinase (JNK),regulates apoptosis.

It was found that PDK2 was up-regulated in the arterial wall of patients with pulmonary arterial hypertension and was found to inhibit apoptosis and promote cell proliferation by inhibiting mitochondrial function in the pulmonary hypertension model.

PDPK1 is a crucial signaling mediator in multiple myeloma proliferation and survival.Inhibition of PDPK1 can activate BIM and BAD and enhance the cytotoxic effects of antimyeloma agents.PDPK1 knockdown can exert anti-multiple myeloma effects by inducing cell cycle arrest and apoptosis in KMS-18 cells.

The apoptosis rate of ¦Â cells in PDX1 heterozygous mice increases, which is related to the coordination of cell apoptosis and can be regulated by PDX1. Low PDX1 expression is related to increased islet apoptosis in the Psammomys obesus model and diabetes.

PEA15 is an important molecular switch that regulates apoptosis by inhibiting Fas-mediated apoptosis through binding with FADD. In its unphosphorylated state, PEA15 binds to ERK and sequesters it in the cytoplasm, thus regulating cell proliferation. However, when phosphorylated, it binds to FADD and affects apoptosis.

description: pellino E3 ubiquitin protein ligase family member 3
comment: PELI3 regulates cell apoptosis by inhibiting the formation of complex II and caspase 8-mediated cleavage of RIP1 induced by TNF. PELI3 deficiency makes cells more sensitive to TNF-induced apoptosis.

description: p53 apoptosis effector related to PMP22
comment: PERP is a downstream mediator of p53-dependent apoptotic pathway and can induce cell death.

PF4 induces apoptosis, inhibits the proliferation of multiple myeloma cells and induces them to enter apoptosis. PF4 has been found to be an effective apoptotic agent in multiple myeloma (MM) cell lines and primary MM cells. PF4 negatively regulates STAT3 and inhibits constitutive and interleukin-6-induced phosphorylation of STAT3, which helps regulate proliferation, apoptosis, and angiogenesis in MM by regulating the expression of its target genes. PF4 can also induce apoptosis by binding to Lipoprotein receptor-related protein-1(LRP1). Knockdown LRP1 expression can completely abolish the pro-apoptotic effect of PF4.

description: pleckstrin homology like domain family A member 3
comment: PHLDA3 induces apoptosis by inhibiting Akt activity through its PH domain. Therefore, it acts as a tumor suppressor in lung endocrine tumors and is also a downstream mediator of p53-dependent apoptosis.

Experiments in the article show that PIAS4 silencing significantly promotes apoptosis of Huh-7 and HepG-2 cells. On the other hand, PIAS4 upregulation promotes the growth, migration, and invasion of hepatocellular carcinoma cells.

PIDD1 participating in the signal transduction pathway after DNA damage to activate caspase-2,ultimately leading to apoptosis.When FANCI fails to repair Interstrand crosslinks,it interacts with PIDD1,thereby participating in cellular apoptosis.

PIH1D1 can interact with Monad and RPAP3 to regulate apoptosis in U2OS cells. The research results also show that knockdown of PIH1D1 promotes caspase activation, which increases the possibility of apoptosis.

PIK3R1 is highly expressed in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC), and its knockdown inhibits the proliferation and migration of HCC cell lines and promotes apoptosis. Specifically, knockdown of PIK3R1 downregulates the expression of p-PI3K, p-AKT, and p-mTOR in MHCC97H and HCCLM3 cells.

PINK1 can protect cells against oxidative stress-induced apoptosis, which is related to the pathogenesis of Parkinson's disease. In the absence of PINK1, cells are more susceptible to apoptosis after exposure to mitochondrial toxins. Conversely, overexpression of wild-type PINK1 can protect cells against death mediated by chemical insults.

PLAGL2 expression causes cells to enter the G0/G1 phase of the cell cycle and causes DNA fragmentation. Transfecting PLAGL2 cDNA can be used to judge cell apoptosis through multiple experiments such as TUNEL, DNA fragmentation, propidium iodide staining, and the binding of annexin V. The study also demonstrates that the regulation of Nip3 is a direct factor of PLAGL2 inducing cell apoptosis, which comes from the transcriptional activation of PLAGL2.

The downregulation of PLAUR (urokinase-type plasminogen activator receptor) enhances radiation-induced apoptosis in glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) cells, reduces the expression of Survivin in GBM cells, and enhances DNA damage to induce apoptosis. Survivin is a member of the inhibitor of apoptosis protein family with anti-apoptotic activity.

description: pleckstrin homology and FYVE domain containing 1
comment: PLEKHF1 is a protein that mediates apoptosis by interacting with phosphorylated p53, triggering lysosomal destruction and apoptosis. It was found that phosphorylated p53 can translocate to lysosomes via forming complexes with adaptor protein LAPF and subsequently result in LMP and apoptosis in a transcription-independent manner.

PLSCR3 is involved in various apoptosis pathways,such as UV and tBid-induced apoptosis,TNF-related apoptosis-inducing ligand (TRAIL) and cardiolipin-induced mitochondrial apoptosis,PKC¦Ä-induced apoptosis.In addition,PLSCR3 also induces LPS-stimulated microbial exotoxin-induced DNA fibroblast growth factor (FGF2)-dependent T cell apoptosis.

PMAIP1 is a gene that regulates cell apoptosis. It encodes the PUMA protein, an important member of the p53 family. The study found that the apoptotic response to genotoxic stress requires p53 and Puma, while ER stress-induced apoptosis requires p63 and Puma, and oxidative stress-induced apoptotic response requires p63, Noxa, and Puma.Puma is a common mediator in these stress pathways, and that a Puma inhibitor may have therapeutic application.

PML is an essential tumor suppressor gene that can regulate various cellular functions, including apoptosis, by regulating PML nuclear bodies (PML-NBs). PML does not regulate apoptosis in a linear way but rather in a finely tuned regulatory network that depends on the cellular context and the apoptotic stimulus. PML is involved in multiple apoptotic pathways as a growth suppressor, exerting a tumor-suppressive role. It participates in regulating the activity of various proteins involved in different pathways.

Deficiency of POLB inhibits autophagy, exacerbates intracellular A¦Â accumulation, and increases apoptotic response.The lack of Pol¦Â leads to neuronal death, early synaptic dysfunction, and apoptotic responses, accelerating Alzheimer's disease progression and cognitive decline. The DNA damage-induced apoptotic response can result in cell death, and sub-lethal levels of apoptosis can also act as a potent inhibitor of autophagy.

POU4F1 is a transcription factor that interacts with p73 isoforms arising from neural crest during neuronal development or injury, affecting the cell fate of sensory neurons. Research has shown that POU4F1 physically interacts with specific p73 isoforms and cooperatively regulates cell fate. Co-expression of TAp73 and POU4F1 enhances cell cycle arrest, while cooperation between POU4F1 and DNp73 increases protection from apoptosis.

POU4F2 can affect cell death decisions by modulating the action of p53, and its effects with p53 depend on the cell type. For example, in neuronal cells, co-expression of POU4F2 with p53 promotes cell cycle arrest and survival, while in other types of cells such as cancer cells, POU4F2 expression may promote cell proliferation by regulating downstream p53 target gene expression, or enhance the transcription of the apoptotic gene Bax by co-expression with p53, leading to cell death.

PPARD promotes macrophage engulfment of apoptotic cells and exerts transcriptional activity during apoptosis. PPARD acts as a "transcriptional sensor" that is activated when macrophages engulf apoptotic cells. Genetic deletion of PPARD leads to impaired macrophage uptake of apoptotic cells and reduced production of anti-inflammatory cytokines. PPARD plays a critical role in coordinating the timely processing of apoptotic cells for maintaining self-tolerance. PPARD encourages macrophage engulfment of apoptotic cells by regulating the expression of opsonins, which help macrophages recognize the unique chemical composition of surface molecules on apoptotic cells.

PPIA encodes Cyclophilin A (CyPA),which plays a critical role in inflammation and cell death.CyPA promotes apoptosis,vascular smooth muscle cell migration and proliferation,endothelial cell adhesion molecule expression,inflammatory cell chemotaxis,and apoptosis by activating the cell apoptotic and inflammatory signaling pathways.
PPIF encodes Cyclophilin D,a key protein that regulates the permeability transition pore of mitochondria.The opening of PTP can lead to mitochondrial damage and cell apoptosis.

PPM1F can affect apoptosis by negatively regulating the TAK1 signaling pathway. When cells are stimulated by DNA damage and other factors, TAK1 is activated and plays an important role in the IKK-NF-¦ÊB pathway, leading to an increase in the transcription of anti-apoptotic proteins and higher cell survival. However, when the level of PPM1F is high, the cells are more susceptible to apoptosis induced by apoptotic agents, including etoposide.
PPP1CA can inhibit cell apoptosis by suppressing the ROS/mitogen-activated protein kinase/caspase-3 signaling pathway and promoting M2 macrophage polarization to inhibit pyroptosis in adipocytes.

PPP1R13B directly interacts with p53 and selectively regulates its transcriptional activity to promote apoptosis, and is associated with carcinogenesis and cytotoxic resistance. This study identifies an inter-regulatory loop between PPP1R13B and Early Growth Response 1 (EGR-1), which promotes apoptosis by inhibiting cytoprotective autophagy, providing new insights into EGR-1/PPP1R13B regulatory loop in improving cancer's response to pro-apoptosis treatments.

PPP1R15A protein is closely related to apoptosis by modulating the activity of PP1 and interacting with proteins that regulate phosphatase activity. PPP1R15A can substitute the carboxyl region similarity with HSV1 ICP34.5 and African swine fever virus NL for the similar ICP34.5 region to prevent apoptosis of HSV1-infected cells. Overexpression of PPP1R15A can lead to apoptosis.
Studies have shown that inhibiting PPP2R1B expression in AML12 cells results in cell apoptosis, indicating a possible negative correlation between PPP2R1B and apoptosis.

The protein encoded by PPP3CC is a phosphatase that can inhibit the activity of apoptosis-related molecules such as AKT in the signal transduction process, thereby inhibiting apoptosis and promoting malignant cell growth. MiR-200c-3p is the main regulatory gene of EOC, and its high expression level can inhibit cell apoptosis by downregulating PPP3CC expression and promoting AKT pathway activation. PPP3CC has a regulatory relationship with Bcl-2, which is an apoptosis-related protein. When PPP3CC expression levels are upregulated, Bcl-2 expression is inhibited, which accelerates cell apoptosis.

description: protein phosphatase 3 regulatory subunit B, alpha
comment: PPP3R1 encodes one of the regulatory subunits of calcineurin, which acts as a protein phosphatase and responds to increases in intracellular calcium levels. Calcineurin has been shown to play a regulatory role in cell apoptosis. Studies suggest that PPP3R1 mutations lead to abnormal intranuclear localization of calcineurin, which can trigger cell apoptosis and tumors.

Inhibition of PRDX2 leads to an increase in apoptotic rate and the expression of p21 and p-p53/p53 ratios, thus being involved in regulating mitochondrial ROS signaling, ATM-mediated DNA damage response, and so on. In addition, the loss of PRDX2 can also increase the activity of NF-¦ÊB and caspases, leading to increased apoptosis.

PRELID1 binds with the p53-regulated protein TRIAP1 to form a complex located in the mitochondrial intermembrane space (IMS), and ensures the accumulation of cardiolipin (CL) in mitochondrial membranes. TRIAP1/PRELID1 complexes have lipid transfer activity in vitro and supply phosphatidic acid (PA) for CL synthesis in the inner membrane. Loss of TRIAP1 or PRELID1 impairs the accumulation of CL, facilitating cytochrome c release and resulting in apoptosis upon intrinsic and extrinsic stimulation.

PRKCA is associated with the survival and apoptosis of M-HCC cells. The single-cloned antibody inhibition of PRKCA expression can lead to a decrease in survival rate and induce apoptosis of M-HCC cells. Meanwhile, the main effect of UCN-01 inducing M-HCC cell apoptosis is through suppressing the PKC activity.

When the EcRB1/USP1 transcription complex is activated, 20-hydroxyecdysone upregulates PRKCD expression in several areas of the insect's body. PRKCD is involved in apoptosis by directly phosphorylating EcRB1 in the nucleus, and its phosphorylation at threonine residue 1343 is necessary for its activation of caspase-3.

description: parkin RBR E3 ubiquitin protein ligase
comment: PRKN participates in apoptosis by inducing monoubiquitination of VDAC1. Monoubiquitinated VDAC1 forms the mitochondrial calcium uniporter (MCU) channel, which increases calcium uptake and hampers mitophagy while promoting apoptosis. The PRKN T415N mutation cannot induce monoubiquitination of VDAC1, leading to the execution of the apoptotic process.

description: protein activator of interferon induced protein kinase EIF2AK2
comment: PRKRA acts as an activator of PKR in response to interferon-induced double-stranded RNA and participates in apoptosis and regulates its rate and duration. The P222L mutant has enhanced homodimer formation ability, leading to delayed but persistent activation of PKR, which changes the dynamic and duration of eIF2¦Á phosphorylation induced by ER stress. These changes promote apoptosis in Dystonia patient cells by enhancing ER stress response.

PRODH induces apoptosis through the generation of ROS, especially superoxide radicals, via the mitochondrial pathway. It also activates the extrinsic or death receptor pathway to induce cell death. In colorectal cancer cells, PRODH induces the expression of TRAIL and DR5 as well as cleavage of caspase-8. NFAT signaling pathway has a regulatory role in PRODH-mediated TRAIL activation while MEK/ERK signaling pathway is involved.

PSEN1 participates in apoptosis by protecting against neurodegeneration caused by PAG-induced apoptosis. The study found that wild-type PSEN1 can protect neurons from PAG-induced apoptosis, while PSEN1 mutants cannot. The researchers also discovered that overexpression of PAG can accelerate neuronal death induced by nerve growth factor deprivation, and this effect is blocked by wild-type PSEN1. Therefore, PSEN1 plays an important role in protecting neurons from apoptosis.

The authors found that PSMD10 protects colon cancer cells from TNF-induced cell death, acting as an anti-apoptotic factor that overcomes TNF-induced apoptosis. They further found that PSMD10 influences key players such as ¦Â-catenin and RB1, but also has a surprising role in NF¦ÊB activation, which is required to protect cells from TNF-induced cell death.

PSME3 downregulates the regulation of the tumor suppressor p53 while promoting oncogenic pathways such as activating YAP and mTORC1 signaling pathways, leading to its upregulation in multiple cancers and promoting tumor development. In addition, PSME3 can also control and inhibit apoptosis by regulating caspase activity and maintaining cellular energy levels.

PTEN is involved in regulating the expression of Bnip3 and HIF-2¦Á, which induces cell apoptosis and cavity formation. The results of the study suggest a new molecular mechanism for PTEN in promoting apoptosis and lumen formation during epithelial morphogenesis independently of its phosphatase activity.
In the diabetic retina, nitration and inactivation of PTGIS are important mechanisms leading to cell apoptosis and vascular pathology changes.
PTH participates in apoptosis by suppressing apoptosis in early osteoblast precursor cells.

PTPMT1 promotes cancer cell proliferation by inhibiting apoptosis.PTPMT1 is a dual specificity phosphatase that predominantly localizes to mitochondria and the nucleus.Previous studies found that PTPMT1 inhibited apoptosis and promoted proliferation in cancer cells,indicating the oncogenic role of PTPMT1.

PTPMT1 promotes cancer cell proliferation by inhibiting apoptosis.PTPMT1 is a dual specificity phosphatase that predominantly localizes to mitochondria and the nucleus.Previous studies found that PTPMT1 inhibited apoptosis and promoted proliferation in cancer cells,indicating the oncogenic role of PTPMT1.

PTPN1 participates in apoptosis by regulating the phosphorylation of mitochondrial and cysteine protease activating protein 2 (caspase-3) induced by endoplasmic reticulum stress (ERS). Genetic deletion or pharmacological inhibition of PTPN1 mitigates ERS-induced apoptosis in endothelial cells and protects endothelial integrity by reducing the activation of caspase-3 in the p38/JNK-caspase pathway.

The reduction of PTPN2 could induce apoptosis and cell cycle changes in pancreatic adenocarcinoma (PAAD) cells.The authors further investigated the critical factors regulating PTPN2's effect on PAAD progression and identified STAT1 and EGFR as key factors.

description: protein tyrosine phosphatase receptor type C
comment: PTPRC affects the phosphorylation state of signaling molecules and thereby affects the activation and apoptosis of T and B cells by regulating the activity of intracellular tyrosine phosphatases. Moreover, PTPRC is directly involved in cell death response, such as by catalyzing the phosphorylation of DFF45 to release DFF40 and activate endonuclease that cleaves DNA into oligonucleotides fragments and activating cytochrome C during apoptosis.

PTTG1IP participates in apoptosis by regulating p53 activity. When the expression of PTTG1IP protein decreases, the expression of p53 target genes such as p21, caspase-3/7, and the level of apoptosis all increase significantly. In addition, when the PTTG1IP expression of TPC1 cells decreases, their sensitivity to irradiation increases, and cell survival significantly decreases.

PYCARD controls apoptosis by regulating the expression of PYCARD, which is a key point in the PYCARD pathway. PYCARD encodes a signaling factor that operates in the intrinsic and extrinsic cell death pathways. In addition, PYCARD is epigenetically silenced in a wide range of human tumors through DNMT1-mediated regulation. PYCARD regulates PYCARD's DNA methylation and histone H3K9 dimethylation, thereby affecting the process of apoptosis.
During HCMV infection, hcmv-miR-US4-1 down-regulates QARS1 expression, promotes apoptosis of host cells, and facilitates the release of infectious virus particles.
RACK1 participates in apoptosis by inhibiting the anti-apoptotic protein Bcl-2 and activating the pro-apoptotic protein Bax, thus mediating TGF-¦Â1-induced apoptosis.

RAF1 participates in apoptosis by binding with Bcl-2 on the mitochondria. As a docking site, Bcl-2 allows RAF1 to interact with BAG-1 and activate this kinase. By being localized to the mitochondria and mediating phosphorylation of BAD protein in its vicinity, RAF1 contributes to cellular survival.

Overexpression of miR-192 led to decreased RB1 mRNA and protein levels, as well as repressed RB1-30-UTR reporter activity. Knockdown of RB1 using siRNA resulted in a similar cell morphology as observed with overexpression of miR-192. RB1 has been shown to inhibit apoptosis in previous studies.

RB1CC1 participates in apoptosis of neural stem cells through a p53-dependent pathway. In postnatal brains, the loss of the RB1CC1 gene leads to p53-dependent apoptotic responses and cell cycle arrest.

description: RANBP2-type and C3HC4-type zinc finger containing 1
comment: With the inhibition of RBCK1, the apoptosis rate of RCC cells increased significantly, especially in early apoptosis. This is because RBCK1 depletion causes G1 cell cycle arrest of renal cancer cells and leads to apoptosis.
Results from the study showed that RELA protects chondrocytes from apoptosis through induction of anti-apoptotic genes.

RET forms a complex with caspase 3 and PKCd and is cleaved. This process leads to the generation of IC-Ret and overexpression of Pit-1. Pit-1 increases the expression of p53 and apoptosis, resulting in the death of somatotrophs. RET can also induce Pit-1 expression and trigger apoptosis by activating PKCd and JNK.

description: ring finger and FYVE like domain containing E3 ubiquitin protein ligase
comment: RFFL is an endosome-associated ubiquitin ligase protein, also known as caspases-8- and -10-associated RING protein 2 (CARP-2), which contributes to tumorigenesis by negatively regulating the levels of caspases and tumor suppressor genes through its direct ubiquitination and targeting for proteasomal degradation.

RHOT1 participates in apoptosis through overexpression of the RHOT1/Val-13 mutant which leads to the collapse and aggregation of the mitochondrial network, resulting in an increased rate of apoptosis. RHOT1/Val-13 is stable within the mitochondrial structure but is dispersed throughout the cytoplasm and leads to an increase in cytochrome C.
The involvement of RHOT2 in apoptosis is through the initiation of mitochondrial network aggregation by MRHOT1/Val-13, leading to mitochondrial instability and cell apoptosis.

RIPK1 is involved in three different types of cell death: necroptosis, RIPK1-independent and RIPK1-dependent apoptosis. Among them, TAK1-mediated phosphorylation of RIPK1 determines which of the three types of death takes place.

RIPK3 participates in apoptosis by eliminating its negative regulator Caspase-8, leading to a unique programed cell death called necroptosis. The kinase activity of RIPK3 is a critical factor mediating necroptosis.

RNF183 is a transmembrane protein and an E3 ligase that targets the endoplasmic reticulum and mediates ER stress-induced apoptosis. When misfolded protein leads to ER stress, RNF183 reduces the level of miR-7 and increases the stability of RNF183 transcripts, initiating apoptotic cell death after a prolonged period of ER stress. It is proposed that RNF183 interacts with Bcl-xL and polyubiquitinates Bcl-xL for degradation.

RNF186 participates in stress-induced apoptosis by regulating BNIP1 through ubiquitination. RNF186 can co-localize and bind with BNIP1 in the endoplasmic reticulum, conjugating polyubiquitin through K29 and K63 linkage to BNIP1 and promoting the ubiquitylated BNIP1 transfer from the endoplasmic reticulum to the mitochondria. Since BNIP1 can induce a moderate level of cell apoptosis, RNF186 may regulate stress-induced apoptosis by ubiquitination-mediated regulation of BNIP1.

BNIP1 participates in apoptosis by collaborating with FATE1 and RNF183 to suppress the level of BIK protein, therefore escaping from BIK-related apoptotic signaling. Additionally, BNIP1 has been found to have functional overlap with the BH3 domain, promoting cellular apoptosis.

RNF34 is a negative regulator of the activation of DED caspases involved in apoptotic signal transduction. Silencing of RNF34 expression enhances the sensitivity of cells to death ligand-induced apoptosis by promoting the activation of DED caspases. Conversely, overexpression of RNF34 helps cells resist death ligand-induced apoptosis.

RNF41 participates in Apoptosis by degrading the BRUCE protein. RNF41 catalyzes ubiquitination of BRUCE in conjunction with the UbcH5c enzyme, leading to its degradation. Decreasing BRUCE levels by RNA interference or Apoptosis stimulation promotes cell death. Additionally, RNF41-mediated ubiquitination and proteasomal degradation of BRUCE are considered a key event in inducing Apoptosis in various cell types.

RPL11 participates in apoptosis by promoting p53 activation through its binding with RPS27a, which is achieved by its binding with the MDM2 protein. When RPS27a is knocked down, its binding with RPL11 is weakened, which enhances RPL11's binding ability and therefore strengthens the interaction between RPL11 and MDM2, preventing MDM2 from ubiquitinating and degrading p53. These effects ultimately promote cell apoptosis.

RPL26 is involved in apoptosis by regulating the mTOR pathway. Researchers found that RPL26 interacts with CDK5RAP3 to regulate the mTOR pathway and maintain cell proliferation. Deficiency of both CDK5RAP3 and RPL26 leads to inhibition of mTOR/p-mTOR protein and triggers autophagy, promoting cell apoptosis and slowing down cell growth. Specifically, RPL26 induces increased autophagy by inhibiting the mTOR pathway, leading to the occurrence of cell apoptosis.

RPS27L participates in regulating apoptosis after DNA damage. The protein level of RPS27L changes in response to different types of damage, being upregulated in response to DNA-damaging agents that induce cell cycle arrest and downregulated in response to antimetabolite agents that induce apoptosis. RPS27L positively regulates p21 protein expression to facilitate p21-mediated cell cycle arrest and protects against DNA damage-induced apoptosis. Thus, RPS27L modulates DNA damage response and functions as a part of the control switch to determine cell fate in DNA damage-p53 response. Depletion of RPS27L sensitizes cells to DNA-damaging chemotherapeutic agents by converting p53 response from growth arrest to apoptosis, demonstrating its anti-apoptotic function in DNA damage response.

RPS3 is involved in regulating neuronal apoptosis. Under the activation of NGF signal and Akt, the pro-apoptotic function of RPS3 is inhibited, causing the accumulation of RPS3 protein in the nucleus and performing endonuclease function, which maintains neuronal survival. In neurons, RPS3 is involved in the induction of apoptosis at multiple levels (including the activation of upstream apoptotic machinery such as caspase-3 and cytochrome c release). Additionally, RPS3 can induce neuronal apoptosis by up-regulating BH3-only protein levels through binding to E2F1.

RPS6KB1 is involved in apoptosis by suppressing the expression of phosphorylated p70S6K/p85S6K and cdc2/cdk1 proteins in multiple DLBCL cell lines. The authors found that rapamycin and UCN-01, drugs targeting these two proteins, could synergize to inhibit DLBCL proliferation in these cell lines. Additionally, they induced apoptosis by suppressing CDC2 and survivin expression.

RPS7 plays a role in promoting apoptosis. The study found that RPS7 itself and RPS7-Ubiquitin Fusion Protein have different abilities to promote apoptosis, and RPS7-Ubiquitin Fusion Protein has higher polyubiquitination levels and stronger ability to promote apoptosis.

RRP8 participates in apoptosis by inhibiting rRNA synthesis, thereby protecting cells from energy deprivation-induced apoptosis. When cellular energy status decreases, SIRT1 is activated and recruits SUV39H1 to the rDNA locus, establishing silent chromatin by deacetylating histone H3 and dimethylating at Lys9. Lack of RRP8 increases pre-rRNA levels, making cells more susceptible to apoptosis under energy deprivation.
RTKN2's expression is regulated by hsa_circRNA_104348 and through experiments, it was found that hsa_circRNA_104348 upregulated the expression of RTKN2 and suppressed apoptosis of cells.

RTL10 is involved in the regulatory network of apoptosis to process intrinsic apoptotic signaling.RTL10 participates in apoptosis by relying on its BH3 domain and mainly localizes to mitochondria. RTL10 can contact the loop region of voltage-dependent anion channel 1 (VDAC1) in the outer mitochondrial membrane through its BH3 domain, inducing changes in mitochondrial transmembrane potential and the release of cytochrome c. In addition, RTL10 can contact some pro-survival Bcl-2 family members and be inhibited by them.
S100A8 participates in apoptosis through ROS-mediated cross-talk between mitochondria and lysosomes that involves BNIP3.

The protein complex formed by S100A8 and S100A9 can induce apoptosis and autophagy-like cell death through ROS-mediated cross-talk between mitochondria and lysosomes, and the process involves the action of BNIP3.

SCG2 participates in apoptosis resistance and neuroblastoma cell differentiation. The study showed that SCG2 is an AP-1-regulated protein that counteracts nitric oxide-induced apoptosis and mediates neuronal differentiation of neuroblastoma cells.

FOXD3 is a transcription factor that has been shown to be an essential factor for maintaining the self-renewal and pluripotency of early neural crest-derived progenitor cells. In epilepsy, FOXD3 enhances the survival of neuronal cells by suppressing the expression of SCN2A and inhibiting cell apoptosis.PVT1 exacerbates neuronal cell apoptosis and neuroinflammation through the miR-488-3p/FOXD3/SCN2A pathway. In summary, SCN2A can affect cell survival and neuronal apoptosis and is an important target for epilepsy.

As a neural-specific transcription factor, SCRT2 maintains low levels of the p53 upregulated modulator of apoptosis (Puma) during embryonic development to help newly differentiated neurons survive. When DNA is damaged and p53 is activated, SCRT2 represses Puma expression, thus antagonizing p53-mediated apoptosis.

SELENOK participates in apoptosis by regulating the endoplasmic reticulum stress (ERS) pathway and intracellular Ca2+ concentration, affecting programmed cell death. SELENOK knockout induces ER stress, activates the m-calpain/caspase-12 cascade, leading to caspase-3 activation and cell apoptosis. Additionally, SELENOK gene knockout in mice and neuroblastoma cells can induce cell apoptosis, increase intracellular Ca2+ concentration, reduce antioxidant capacity, and impair cognitive ability while increasing anxiety.

SELENOS participates in apoptosis by affecting the PI3K/Akt signaling pathway. When cells are exposed to oxidative stress, the PI3K/Akt signaling pathway is upregulated and increases the production of oxidative stress by downregulating Glutathione peroxidase-1, which ultimately leads to cell apoptosis. The addition of Se can downregulate the PI3K/Akt signaling pathway and Glutathione peroxidase-1, thereby reducing the production of oxidative stress in cells and resisting apoptosis.

The mechanism by which SENP1 participates in apoptosis is by inhibiting the activation of RIPK1 to prevent NASH, thereby limiting cell death and inflammation. SENP1 deficiency increases cell sensitivity to RIPK1 kinase-dependent cell death, leading to the degradation of anti-apoptotic factors and increased cell death.

SEPTIN4 participates in apoptosis in cardiomyocytes by enhancing the VHL-mediated degradation of HIF-1¦Á. By reducing cardio-protective factor HIF-1¦Á levels, SEPTIN4 aggravates hypoxia-induced cardiomyocyte apoptosis.

SERINC3 participates in apoptosis by partially inhibiting apoptosis and improving cell survival through overexpression. Specifically, overexpression of SERINC3 can partially protect cells from serum starvation and Etoposide-induced apoptosis.

SERPINE1 plays a role in protecting endothelial cells from Fas/FasL-mediated apoptosis and has the ability to inhibit Apoptosis. When SERPINE1 is downregulated in ECs, the occurrence of cell apoptosis increases by more than 5 times. In addition, in the absence of SERPINE1, plasmin will facilitate the release of soluble FasL from the cell membrane surface, which activates Fas and induces ECs apoptosis.

SFN affects Apoptosis by participating in apoptosis. In this paper, SFN is elevated in patients with acute lung injury caused by pulmonary epithelial cell damage via apoptosis. The experiment showed that the p53 transcription factor and its transcription targets (such as p21 and K18) are involved in apoptosis induced by JNJ26854165 and Nutlin-3, and can induce the release of SFN by alveolar epithelial cells. During cell damage, SFN can be released into the extracellular environment through apoptosis, resulting in an increase in blood SFN levels.

description: splicing factor proline and glutamine rich
comment: SFPQ participates in Apoptosis to affect cell growth. This paper mentions that overexpression of SFPQ can inhibit the proliferation and induce apoptosis of NPM/ALK-expressing cells.
SFRP1 is involved in apoptosis by increasing the sensitivity of MCF7 cells to cytotoxic agents.

SFRP2 participates in Apoptosis by regulating cell response to pro-apoptotic stimuli and exerting anti-apoptotic activity.SFRP2 is expressed in quiescent 10T1/2 cells but not in exponentially growing cells, suggesting its correlation with cell resistance to apoptosis.Conditioned medium from quiescent 10T1/2 cells possesses anti-apoptotic activity, which contains SFRP2.Transfection of SFRP2 in MCF7 cells results in decreased sensitivity to TNF and ceramide.

Mats, a protein in the SGMS1 protein family, acts as a tumor suppressor in Drosophila, controlling cell proliferation and apoptosis. Mats works in conjunction with Large tumor suppressor/Warts protein kinase to regulate cell proliferation and apoptosis. Mats physically associates with Warts to stimulate the catalytic activity of the Warts kinase. Loss of Mats function resulted in increased cell proliferation, defective apoptosis, and induction of tissue overgrowth.

The mechanism of SGPL1 involved in Apoptosis is that SGPL1 increases stress-induced ceramide generation and apoptosis by reducing intracellular S1P. At the same time, enzymatic activity is also a necessary factor in promoting Apoptosis. Overexpression of SGPL1 can increase stress-induced ceramide generation and apoptosis.

SGPP1 participates in Apoptosis by regulating intra- and extracellular S1P levels, thereby affecting cell growth resistance. Knockdown of endogenous SGPP1 causes S1P accumulation, leading to significant resistance to cytotoxic agents and reduced apoptosis.

SH3RF1 participates in apoptosis by serving as a protein assembly platform, which can assemble the Rac to JNK signaling pathway, resulting in cell apoptosis. Apoptosis can be prevented by co-expressing Akt. The study finds that SH3RF1 is a direct substrate for phosphorylation by Akt in vivo and in vitro, with serine 304 of SH3RF1 identified as the major site of Akt phosphorylation within the Rac-binding domain. Phosphorylation of SH3RF1 leads to decreased ability to bind activated Rac and reduced ability to induce apoptosis. This finding identifies Akt as a key regulator of apoptotic pathways at the level of the SH3RF1-JIP apoptotic complex (PJAC), affecting phosphorylation-dependent SH3RF1 function and inhibiting PJAC assembly to prevent apoptotic signaling by JNK.

The PI3K and SHH pathways synergize to promote tumor growth and viability in human PTEN-deficient glioblastomas. Simultaneously inhibiting these pathways leads to mitotic catastrophe and apoptosis and significantly reduces the growth of PTEN-deficient glioblastomas both in vitro and in vivo. Combination therapy targeting both PI3K and SHH pathways dramatically reduces the survival of PTEN-deficient glioblastomas.

SHISA5 is a new p53 transcriptional target gene that is activated in response to DNA damage, particularly after radiation therapy. SHISA5 is mainly located in the endoplasmic reticulum (ER) and nuclear membrane, inducing cell apoptosis through cysteine protease-dependent mechanisms. Gene silencing experiments have shown that SHISA5 inhibition increases resistance to p53-mediated cell apoptosis induced by DNA damage, indicating that SHISA5 plays a role in this process. The apoptotic activity of SHISA5 is intrinsic, not due to overexpression of ER membrane proteins leading to ER dysfunction.

SIAH1 participates in apoptosis by activating the JNK pathway through interaction with POSH proteins. The study shows that after receiving apoptotic induction, cells increase their protein levels of SIAH1 through increased stability, which requires activation of the JNK pathway and interaction with POSH proteins. Phosphorylation of SIAH1 at tyrosines 100 and 126 further enhances its stability. Depletion of intracellular Siah proteins via small interference RNA partially protects cells from death evoked by apoptotic stimuli.
